recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cut the guanciale into thin strips.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and add the spaghetti.
In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, pecorino, parmigiano, and black pepper.
Cook the guanciale in a pan over medium heat until crispy and the fat renders.
Reserve 1–2 tablespoons of guanciale fat in the pan.
When the pasta is al dente, transfer it directly to the pan with guanciale fat.
Toss well off the heat to coat the pasta in the rendered fat.
Add the egg-cheese mixture, stirring quickly to avoid scrambling.
Add pasta water gradually to achieve a creamy sauce.
Fold in the crispy guanciale and finish with more black pepper.

recipes.name: Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to highest temperature (250–300°C).
Stretch the pizza dough into a thin round base.
Spread tomato passata evenly over the dough.
Tear mozzarella into pieces and distribute evenly.
Season lightly with salt.
Bake for 8–12 minutes until crust is charred and cheese melted.
Top with fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil before serving.

recipes.name: Lasagna al Forno
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Sauté chopped onions and garlic in olive oil.
Add beef mince and cook until browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and simmer 20 minutes.
Prepare or heat the béchamel sauce.
Layer lasagna sheets, meat sauce, béchamel, and cheese.
Repeat layers until ingredients are used up.
Top with parmigiano.
Bake 40–45 minutes until bubbling and golden.
Rest 10 minutes before slicing.

recipes.name: Risotto alla Milanese
instructions: Heat stock in a separate pot.
Sauté chopped onion in butter until soft.
Add arborio rice and toast for 1 minute.
Pour in white wine and let evaporate.
Add warm stock ladle by ladle, stirring continuously.
Soak saffron in warm stock and add to the risotto.
Cook until creamy and al dente.
Stir in butter and parmigiano before serving.

recipes.name: Osso Buco
instructions: Season veal shanks and brown in olive oil.
Set aside and sauté chopped vegetables.
Add tomato paste and cook 2 minutes.
Deglaze with white wine.
Return veal shanks to pot.
Pour in beef stock until halfway submerged.
Cover and simmer 1.5–2 hours.
Serve with gremolata or risotto.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Norma
instructions: Salt the eggplant cubes and let drain for 15 minutes.
Rinse and pat dry the eggplant.
Heat olive oil in a pan and fry the eggplant until golden.
Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add tomato passata and simmer for 10 minutes.
Boil pasta until al dente.
Add fried eggplant into the sauce.
Toss pasta with sauce and eggplant.
Serve topped with ricotta salata and fresh basil.

recipes.name: Pasta e Fagioli
instructions: Sauté onion, carrot, celery, and garlic in olive oil.
Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add drained beans and stir well.
Pour in water or broth and bring to a boil.
Add rosemary and simmer for 15 minutes.
Boil pasta separately and add to the pot.
Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer until pasta is tender.
Serve warm with olive oil drizzle.

recipes.name: Chicken Cacciatore
instructions: Season chicken and brown it in olive oil.
Remove chicken and sauté onions, garlic, and peppers.
Deglaze with white wine.
Add tomato sauce and rosemary.
Return chicken to the pot.
Add olives and stir gently.
Cover and simmer 35–40 minutes.
Serve with bread or pasta.

recipes.name: Pesto alla Genovese
instructions: Wash and dry basil thoroughly.
Blend basil with pine nuts and garlic.
Add parmigiano and pecorino.
Slowly drizzle olive oil while blending.
Season with salt.
Use immediately or store in airtight jar.

recipes.name: Saltimbocca alla Romana
instructions: Lay prosciutto slices on each veal cutlet.
Top with a sage leaf and secure with a toothpick.
Melt butter in a pan and sear the veal.
Flip and cook the other side.
Deglaze with white wine.
Reduce until glossy.
Serve hot with the pan sauce.

recipes.name: Tagliatelle al Ragù Bolognese
instructions: Heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion, carrot, and celery.
Add beef and pork mince and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato paste and cook 2 minutes.
Deglaze with red wine and simmer until evaporated.
Add water or stock and simmer on very low heat for 1.5–2 hours.
Add a splash of milk near the end for richness.
Cook tagliatelle until al dente.
Toss pasta with the ragù and serve hot.

recipes.name: Gnocchi al Pesto
instructions: Bring salted water to a boil.
Add gnocchi and cook until they float to the surface.
Drain gently.
Toss with fresh basil pesto.
Top with parmigiano and a drizzle of olive oil.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Polenta Taragna
instructions: Bring water or broth to a boil.
Add polenta and buckwheat flour while stirring.
Cook on low heat for 30–40 minutes, stirring often.
Add butter and fontina cheese.
Stir until melted and creamy.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Ribollita
instructions: Sauté onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil.
Add tomato paste and beans.
Pour in water or vegetable broth.
Add chopped cavolo nero.
Simmer for 40 minutes.
Add chunks of stale bread.
Cook until thick and stew-like.
Serve warm with olive oil.

recipes.name: Panzanella
instructions: Soak bread cubes lightly in water, then squeeze excess.
Chop tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion.
Mix vegetables with softened bread.
Add basil leaves.
Dress with olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Toss and serve fresh.

recipes.name: Pasta Puttanesca
instructions: Heat olive oil and fry anchovies until melted.
Add minced garlic and chili flakes.
Add olives and capers and sauté briefly.
Pour in tomato passata.
Simmer for 8 minutes.
Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Toss pasta into the sauce.
Finish with chopped parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Tortellini in Brodo
instructions: Bring chicken broth to a gentle boil.
Add tortellini.
Cook until tortellini rise to the top.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with parmigiano.

recipes.name: Calamari Fritti
instructions: Rinse calamari and pat dry.
Season flour with salt.
Coat calamari in flour.
Heat oil until 180°C.
Fry calamari until golden.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Pappa al Pomodoro
instructions: Heat olive oil and sauté garlic.
Add tomato passata and simmer.
Pour in vegetable broth.
Add chunks of stale bread.
Cook until bread dissolves and thickens.
Season with salt and pepper.
Finish with basil and olive oil.

recipes.name: Arancini di Riso
instructions: Prepare leftover or fresh risotto.
Form a small ball and stuff with mozzarella, peas, and ragù.
Shape into firm balls.
Coat in flour.
Dip in beaten eggs.
Roll in breadcrumbs.
Heat oil to 170–180°C.
Fry until golden brown.
Drain and serve hot.

recipes.name: Frittata di Zucchine
instructions: Slice zucchini into thin rounds.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick pan.
Sauté zucchini until lightly golden.
Whisk eggs with parmigiano, salt, and pepper.
Pour egg mixture over zucchini.
Cook on low heat until edges set.
Flip carefully or finish under a broiler.
Slice and serve warm.

recipes.name: Parmigiana di Melanzane
instructions: Slice eggplants and lightly salt them.
Pat dry and pan-fry or bake until softened.
Spread tomato sauce in a baking dish.
Layer eggplants, mozzarella, tomato sauce, and parmigiano.
Repeat 3–4 layers.
Bake at 190°C for 35–40 minutes.
Rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Garnish with basil.

recipes.name: Cacio e Pepe
instructions: Toast black pepper in a dry pan.
Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Reserve pasta water.
Add pasta water to the pepper pan to create a sauce base.
Add spaghetti.
Off the heat, stir in pecorino vigorously.
Add more pasta water until creamy.
Serve with extra pepper.

recipes.name: Minestrone alla Genovese
instructions: Chop all vegetables evenly.
Heat olive oil and sauté vegetables 3 minutes.
Add water or broth.
Simmer 25 minutes.
Add cannellini beans.
Finish with a spoon of basil pesto.
Adjust seasoning and serve warm.

recipes.name: Pasta al Limone
instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Melt butter in a pan and add lemon zest.
Add a splash of cream and stir.
Pour in lemon juice.
Add pasta with some pasta water.
Toss until creamy.
Finish with parmigiano and pepper.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Orecchiette alle Cime di Rapa
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add cime di rapa and cook for 3 minutes.
Add orecchiette to the same pot.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté garlic and chili flakes.
Drain pasta and greens together.
Toss in the garlic-chili oil.
Adjust salt and serve warm.

recipes.name: Spaghetti alle Vongole
instructions: Soak clams in salted water for 15 minutes to purge sand.
Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Heat olive oil and sauté garlic and chili flakes.
Add clams and white wine.
Cover and cook until clams open.
Add spaghetti to the pan.
Toss with parsley and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Penne all'Arrabbiata
instructions: Cook penne until al dente.
Heat olive oil and fry garlic with chili flakes.
Add tomato passata.
Simmer for 8 minutes.
Toss penne in the sauce.
Finish with chopped parsley.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Vitello Tonnato
instructions: Simmer veal roast in salted water until tender.
Let it cool completely.
Blend tuna, capers, anchovies, egg yolks, and lemon juice.
Whisk in olive oil to form a creamy sauce.
Slice veal thinly.
Layer slices on a plate.
Cover generously with tonnato sauce.
Chill before serving.

recipes.name: Pollo alla Cacciatora Bianca
instructions: Heat olive oil and brown chicken pieces.
Add chopped onion and garlic.
Add rosemary and sage.
Pour in white wine.
Simmer covered for 35–40 minutes.
Reduce sauce to glaze the chicken.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Focaccia Genovese
instructions: Mix warm water and yeast to activate.
Add flour and salt, knead until smooth.
Let the dough rise for 1 hour.
Spread dough on a baking tray.
Dimple the surface with fingers.
Drizzle olive oil and sprinkle coarse salt.
Bake at 220°C for 18–20 minutes.
Cool slightly before slicing.

recipes.name: Pasta al Pomodoro
instructions: Cook pasta until al dente.
Heat olive oil and sauté garlic lightly.
Add tomato passata and simmer 8 minutes.
Season with salt.
Add basil leaves.
Toss pasta with the sauce.
Serve with olive oil drizzle.

recipes.name: Penne alla Vodka
instructions: Cook penne to al dente.
Sauté garlic and chili flakes in butter.
Add tomato paste and cook until darkened.
Pour in vodka and let evaporate.
Add cream and stir well.
Toss penne in the sauce.
Simmer 1–2 minutes until glossy.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Gricia
instructions: Cook pasta until al dente.
Cut guanciale into strips and cook until crispy.
Reserve the rendered fat.
Add pasta to the pan with guanciale fat.
Add grated pecorino and pepper off the heat.
Add pasta water to emulsify.
Serve with more pecorino.

recipes.name: Pasta Amatriciana
instructions: Cook guanciale until crispy.
Deglaze the pan with white wine.
Add tomato passata and chili flakes.
Simmer 10 minutes.
Cook bucatini until al dente.
Toss pasta with sauce.
Finish with pecorino and serve hot.

recipes.name: Pollo alla Cacciatora Rossa
instructions: Brown chicken thighs in olive oil.
Set chicken aside and sauté chopped vegetables.
Add olives and stir.
Pour in red wine and reduce.
Add tomato passata.
Return chicken to the pot.
Add rosemary and season.
Cover and simmer 45 minutes.
Serve warm with bread or polenta.

recipes.name: Caponata Siciliana
instructions: Cube eggplants, salt them, and let drain.
Fry eggplant pieces until golden.
Sauté onion and celery.
Add tomatoes, olives, and capers.
Add vinegar and sugar for agrodolce flavor.
Simmer 10 minutes.
Fold in fried eggplants.
Let cool and serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Gnocchi alla Sorrentina
instructions: Boil gnocchi until they float.
Mix gnocchi with tomato sauce.
Transfer to a baking dish.
Add mozzarella cubes.
Top with parmigiano.
Bake at 190°C for 10–12 minutes.
Garnish with basil and serve.

recipes.name: Trenette al Pesto
instructions: Bring salted water to a boil.
Add sliced potatoes and green beans.
Add trenette pasta to the same pot.
Cook until pasta is al dente.
Drain lightly and transfer to a bowl.
Mix with fresh pesto.
Top with parmigiano and serve.

recipes.name: Scaloppine al Limone
instructions: Lightly coat veal slices in flour.
Melt butter in a pan.
Sear veal briefly on both sides.
Deglaze with white wine.
Add lemon juice and simmer 2 minutes.
Season and serve warm.

recipes.name: Insalata Caprese
instructions: Slice tomatoes and arrange on a plate.
Slice mozzarella and place alternating with tomato slices.
Add fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle generously with olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Bruschetta al Pomodoro
instructions: Toast bread slices until crisp.
Rub each slice with a cut garlic clove.
Dice tomatoes and mix with olive oil and salt.
Add chopped basil and stir.
Spoon tomato mixture on toasted bread.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pasta al Burro
instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
Reserve a cup of pasta water.
Melt butter in a pan.
Add spaghetti and toss.
Add pasta water to form a glossy coating.
Finish with parmigiano and pepper.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Panzerotti Pugliesi
instructions: Roll dough into small disks.
Add mozzarella and tomato sauce in the center.
Fold into half-moon shapes and seal edges.
Heat oil to 180°C.
Fry panzerotti until golden and puffy.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Carpaccio di Manzo
instructions: Arrange thin beef slices on a chilled plate.
Drizzle with lemon juice.
Add olive oil over the top.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add arugula leaves.
Finish with parmigiano shavings.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pollo alla Diavola
instructions: Butterfly the chicken and flatten it using a heavy pan.
Mix olive oil, chili flakes, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes.
Heat grill or pan on medium-high.
Place chicken skin-side down and press with a weight.
Cook until skin is crisp.
Flip and cook until fully done.
Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Seppie in Umido
instructions: Heat olive oil and sauté garlic.
Add sliced cuttlefish and cook until opaque.
Pour in white wine and let it evaporate.
Add tomato passata and stir well.
Simmer 25–30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Finish with chopped parsley.
Serve warm with bread or polenta.

recipes.name: Crostini Toscani
instructions: Toast bread slices lightly.
Sauté onion in butter and oil.
Add chicken liver and cook thoroughly.
Add capers and anchovies.
Deglaze with white wine.
Blend into a smooth pâté.
Spread on toasted bread.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Zozzona
instructions: Cook rigatoni until al dente.
Brown guanciale in a pan.
Add sausage and cook until browned.
Add tomato passata and simmer.
Mix pecorino with egg yolk in a bowl.
Add pasta to the sauce.
Off heat, add the egg-pecorino mixture.
Stir vigorously to avoid scrambling.
Serve with black pepper.

recipes.name: Tagliata di Manzo
instructions: Season steak with salt, pepper, and rosemary.
Heat grill or cast-iron pan until very hot.
Sear steak 2–3 minutes per side.
Rest the meat for 5 minutes.
Slice thinly against the grain.
Serve on arugula with lemon and olive oil.

recipes.name: Risotto ai Funghi Porcini
instructions: Soak porcini mushrooms in warm water for 15 minutes.
Heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion.
Add drained porcini and cook 2 minutes.
Add the rice and toast for 1 minute.
Pour white wine and allow to evaporate.
Add hot broth one ladle at a time.
Stir continuously for 18–20 minutes.
Finish with butter and parmigiano.
Serve creamy and hot.

recipes.name: Panzanella Toscana
instructions: Soak bread cubes briefly in water and squeeze out excess.
Chop tomatoes, onion, and cucumber.
Combine all vegetables in a bowl.
Add bread pieces and mix gently.
Season with vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Add basil leaves.
Rest 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Frittata di Patate
instructions: Slice boiled potatoes.
Sauté onions in olive oil.
Add potatoes and cook lightly.
Beat eggs with parmigiano, salt, and pepper.
Pour eggs over the potatoes.
Cook on low heat until set.
Flip or finish under a broiler.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Zuppa Toscana
instructions: Brown sausage in olive oil.
Add chopped onion and garlic.
Add sliced potatoes and stir.
Pour in chicken broth.
Simmer until potatoes soften.
Add chopped kale.
Pour cream and mix.
Simmer 5 minutes and serve hot.

recipes.name: Spiedini di Pesce
instructions: Cut fish into bite-sized cubes.
Marinate with olive oil, lemon, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Thread onto skewers.
Preheat grill to medium-high.
Grill 2–3 minutes per side.
Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Sarde a Beccafico
instructions: Mix breadcrumbs, pine nuts, raisins, parsley, and orange zest.
Season the filling with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Place filling on each opened sardine.
Roll sardines and secure if needed.
Arrange in a baking dish.
Drizzle olive oil on top.
Bake at 180°C for 15–18 minutes.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Ribollita
instructions: Sauté onion, carrot, and potato in olive oil.
Add cabbage, kale, and tomatoes.
Add cannellini beans with some of their cooking liquid.
Simmer for 30 minutes.
Layer stale bread at the bottom of the pot.
Pour soup over bread.
Simmer again (“reboil”) for deeper flavor.
Serve with olive oil.

recipes.name: Crespelle alla Fiorentina
instructions: Prepare thin Italian-style crepes.
Cook and chop spinach.
Mix ricotta, spinach, nutmeg, and parmigiano.
Spread filling on crepes and roll them.
Arrange rolls in a baking dish.
Pour béchamel over them.
Sprinkle parmigiano on top.
Bake at 180°C for 15–18 minutes.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Peperonata
instructions: Slice bell peppers and onions.
Sauté onion in olive oil until soft.
Add peppers and cook 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and season.
Simmer for 20 minutes until soft.
Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.name: Tonnarelli Cacio e Pepe
instructions: Toast black pepper in a pan.
Cook tonnarelli until al dente.
Add pasta water to the pepper pan.
Add pasta and toss.
Remove from heat and add pecorino.
Stir vigorously to create a creamy sauce.
Serve with extra pepper.

recipes.name: Cannelloni Ricotta e Spinaci
instructions: Cook spinach and squeeze out excess water.
Mix ricotta, spinach, parmigiano, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Stuff cannelloni tubes with the filling.
Spread tomato sauce in a baking dish.
Arrange cannelloni in the dish.
Cover with béchamel sauce.
Top with parmigiano.
Bake at 180°C for 25–30 minutes.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Risotto al Barolo
instructions: Sauté chopped onion in olive oil.
Toast the rice for 1 minute.
Add a large splash of Barolo wine.
Let alcohol evaporate.
Add hot broth one ladle at a time.
Stir continuously for 18–20 minutes.
Add more wine halfway through for color.
Finish with butter and parmigiano.
Serve creamy.

recipes.name: Branzino al Sale
instructions: Mix coarse salt with egg whites to form a crust mixture.
Stuff fish cavity with lemon and parsley.
Spread a thin layer of salt on a baking tray.
Place fish on top.
Cover completely with the salt mixture.
Bake at 200°C for 30–35 minutes.
Crack the salt crust and remove fish.
Serve with olive oil and lemon.

recipes.name: Polpette al Sugo
instructions: Mix meat with breadcrumbs, egg, parmigiano, garlic, and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Shape into small meatballs.
Brown meatballs in olive oil.
Add tomato sauce to the pan.
Simmer for 25–30 minutes.
Serve with bread or pasta.

recipes.name: Risotto al Limone
instructions: Heat olive oil and sauté lemon zest lightly.
Add rice and toast 1 minute.
Pour broth gradually while stirring.
Add lemon juice halfway through.
Continue cooking until creamy.
Finish with butter and parmigiano.
Serve immediately with more zest.

recipes.name: Gnocchi di Patate
instructions: Boil potatoes until soft.
Peel and mash while warm.
Add flour, egg, and salt.
Knead into a soft dough.
Roll into ropes and cut into gnocchi pieces.
Boil until they float.
Melt butter with sage.
Toss gnocchi in sage butter and serve.

recipes.name: Ziti al Forno
instructions: Cook ziti until slightly underdone.
Brown sausage in olive oil.
Mix ricotta with salt and parmigiano.
Layer pasta, ricotta, sausage, and tomato sauce.
Top with mozzarella and more sauce.
Bake at 180°C for 30–35 minutes.
Rest 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Frittata ai Carciofi
instructions: Slice artichoke hearts.
Sauté them in olive oil.
Beat eggs with parmigiano, salt, and pepper.
Add chopped parsley.
Pour egg mixture into the pan.
Cook on low heat until set.
Flip or broil to finish.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Norma
instructions: Slice eggplants and fry until golden.
Cook pasta until al dente.
Sauté garlic in olive oil.
Add tomato sauce and simmer.
Add basil leaves.
Mix pasta with sauce.
Top with fried eggplants.
Finish with grated ricotta salata.

recipes.name: Saltimbocca alla Romana
instructions: Place a sage leaf on each veal slice.
Wrap with prosciutto and secure gently.
Melt butter in a pan.
Sear veal parcels on each side.
Deglaze with white wine.
Simmer until sauce thickens.
Serve hot with pan juices.

recipes.name: Pasta con le Sarde
instructions: Clean sardines by removing the spine and rinsing lightly.
Boil fennel tops in salted water and reserve the fennel-infused water.
Toast breadcrumbs in olive oil until golden; set aside.
Sauté chopped onion in olive oil until soft.
Add raisins and pine nuts and stir for 1 minute.
Dissolve saffron in warm fennel water.
Add cleaned sardines to the pan and cook gently until they break down.
Boil bucatini in the fennel water until al dente.
Transfer pasta to the sauce and mix gently.
Add saffron liquid and toss until evenly coated.
Serve topped with toasted breadcrumbs.

recipes.name: Farfalle al Salmone
instructions: Start boiling farfalle in salted water.
Melt butter in a pan and sauté finely chopped onion.
Cut smoked salmon into thin strips.
Add the salmon to the pan and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in cream and stir until smooth.
Add lemon zest for aroma.
Season lightly with black pepper.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain farfalle and add it to the cream-salmon sauce.
Loosen the sauce with pasta water if needed.
Toss well and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Pasta e Ceci
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pot and sauté garlic and rosemary.
Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add half the chickpeas and mash them lightly for thickness.
Add the remaining whole chickpeas.
Pour in water or broth and bring to a simmer.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add pasta directly into the pot.
Cook until pasta absorbs the broth and becomes creamy.
Adjust seasoning.
Serve with olive oil drizzle.

recipes.name: Pasta agli Asparagi
instructions: Cut asparagus into small pieces, keeping tips whole.
Blanch asparagus in salted water for 2 minutes.
Cook pasta in the same water.
Sauté garlic in butter until fragrant.
Add asparagus pieces and sauté for 2 minutes.
Reserve pasta water.
Drain pasta and add to the pan.
Toss with asparagus and butter mixture.
Add pasta water to create a light sauce.
Finish with parmigiano and pepper.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Risotto allo Zafferano (Risotto Milanese)
instructions: Warm broth in a separate pot.
Soak saffron threads in a spoon of warm broth.
Sauté chopped onion in butter until translucent.
Add rice and toast for 1 minute.
Pour white wine and let it evaporate.
Add hot broth one ladle at a time.
Stir continuously while simmering.
Add saffron liquid halfway into cooking.
Continue adding broth until creamy.
Remove from heat and add butter.
Finish with parmigiano before serving.

recipes.name: Polenta Taragna
instructions: Boil salted water in a heavy pot.
Slowly pour in cornmeal and buckwheat flour while whisking.
Lower heat to medium-low.
Stir continuously to avoid lumps.
Cook for 25–30 minutes, stirring regularly.
Add butter and mix it in.
Cut fontina cheese into small cubes.
Fold cheese into the polenta until melted.
Continue cooking until thick and creamy.
Adjust salt as needed.
Serve hot with melted butter on top.

recipes.name: Pasta al Tonno
instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water.
Heat olive oil in a pan.
Add sliced garlic and sauté until golden.
Add drained tuna and break into pieces.
Pour in tomato passata and stir.
Simmer for 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain spaghetti and add to sauce.
Toss well, adding pasta water if needed.
Finish with chopped parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Ossobuco alla Milanese
instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper.
Sear them in butter and olive oil until browned.
Remove shanks and set aside.
Sauté chopped carrots, celery, and onions.
Add tomato paste and cook briefly.
Deglaze with white wine.
Return shanks to the pot.
Pour in beef broth to partially cover.
Simmer covered for 90–120 minutes.
Flip shanks halfway through cooking.
Top with gremolata before serving.

recipes.name: Caponata Siciliana
instructions: Cut eggplants into cubes and salt them for 20 minutes.
Rinse and pat dry.
Fry eggplant cubes until soft and golden.
Sauté onions and celery in olive oil.
Add tomatoes, olives, and capers.
Add fried eggplants back to the pan.
Mix vinegar and sugar to create agrodolce (sweet-sour).
Pour the mixture into the pan.
Simmer for 10 minutes.
Adjust seasoning and cool slightly.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Spezzatino di Manzo
instructions: Season beef cubes with salt and pepper.
Brown them in olive oil in batches.
Remove beef and set aside.
Sauté chopped onion, celery, and carrot.
Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze with red wine.
Return beef to the pot.
Add broth and bay leaf.
Simmer covered for 60–90 minutes.
Stir occasionally and adjust liquid if needed.
Serve when meat is tender.

recipes.name: Trenette al Pesto
instructions: Wash basil leaves and dry thoroughly.
Grind garlic and pine nuts in a mortar.
Add basil gradually and crush until creamy.
Add parmigiano and pecorino.
Stream in olive oil to create a smooth pesto.
Boil trenette with diced potatoes in salted water.
Add green beans to the same pot during the last minutes.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain pasta, potatoes, and beans.
Toss gently with pesto off the heat.
Adjust texture with pasta water and serve.

recipes.name: Lasagne al Pesto
instructions: Prepare béchamel sauce and keep warm.
Grease a baking dish lightly with olive oil.
Spread a thin layer of béchamel.
Place lasagne sheets over it.
Spread pesto mixed lightly with béchamel.
Add grated parmigiano.
Repeat layers until dish is full.
Finish with béchamel and parmigiano.
Bake at 180°C for 20–25 minutes.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Gnocchi alla Romana
instructions: Heat milk with salt and nutmeg.
Gradually stir in semolina to avoid lumps.
Cook until very thick.
Remove from heat and add butter.
Stir in egg yolks and parmigiano.
Spread the mixture onto a tray.
Cool completely until firm.
Cut into round disks.
Place discs in a baking dish.
Top with butter and parmigiano.
Bake at 200°C until golden.

recipes.name: Pasta al Limone
instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water.
Melt butter in a pan.
Add lemon zest and warm gently.
Pour in cream and stir.
Season lightly with salt.
Add lemon juice.
Simmer for 2 minutes on low heat.
Reserve pasta water.
Drain spaghetti and add to the sauce.
Toss while adding pasta water for creaminess.
Finish with parmigiano and pepper.

recipes.name: Scaloppine al Vino Bianco
instructions: Season cutlets with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and butter in a pan.
Add cutlets and sear on both sides.
Remove and set aside.
Deglaze pan with white wine.
Scrape browned bits for flavor.
Simmer wine until reduced.
Add cutlets back into the pan.
Cook 2–3 minutes to absorb sauce.
Finish with chopped parsley.
Serve warm with extra pan sauce.

recipes.name: Penne all’Arrabbiata
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
Cook penne until al dente.
Heat olive oil in a pan.
Add sliced garlic and chili flakes.
Sauté until garlic is fragrant but not browned.
Add tomato passata and stir.
Simmer the sauce for 6–7 minutes.
Season with salt.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain penne and add to the sauce.
Toss well, adding pasta water if needed.
Finish with chopped parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Spaghetti alle Vongole
instructions: Rinse clams and soak them in salted water to remove sand.
Cook spaghetti in salted water.
Heat olive oil in a large pan.
Add garlic and chili flakes.
Add clams and stir quickly.
Pour in white wine and cover the pan.
Cook until all clams open.
Remove any that remain shut.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain spaghetti and add to the clam pan.
Toss with clam juices for flavor.
Finish with parsley and serve.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Gricia
instructions: Cut guanciale into thin strips.
Cook guanciale in a pan until crisp and fat renders.
Boil pasta until al dente.
Grate pecorino finely.
Add pasta to guanciale fat.
Add a ladle of pasta water to create a sauce base.
Remove pan from heat.
Add pecorino and mix vigorously.
Stir until creamy and smooth.
Season with black pepper.
Serve immediately while glossy.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Boscaiola
instructions: Slice mushrooms and remove sausage from casing.
Heat olive oil and sauté garlic.
Add sausage and brown it.
Add mushrooms and cook until softened.
Pour white wine and reduce.
Add cream and simmer until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Boil pasta until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain pasta and add to the sauce.
Toss and finish with parsley.

recipes.name: Fusilli alla Caprese
instructions: Halve cherry tomatoes and place in a bowl.
Add olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Tear mozzarella into small pieces.
Add basil leaves.
Boil fusilli until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain pasta and add to the bowl.
Mix gently to avoid breaking mozzarella.
Add pasta water if needed for creaminess.
Adjust seasoning.
Serve warm or room temperature.

recipes.name: Pizzoccheri della Valtellina
instructions: Cut potatoes and cabbage into chunks.
Boil potatoes and cabbage in salted water for 10 minutes.
Add pizzoccheri to the same pot.
Cook everything together until pasta is done.
Drain while reserving a little hot water.
Layer pasta, potatoes, and cabbage in a bowl.
Add thin slices of Casera cheese between layers.
Melt butter in a pan with garlic and sage.
Pour hot sage butter over the dish.
Sprinkle parmigiano.
Serve immediately while the cheese melts.

recipes.name: Pasta al Prosciutto e Piselli
instructions: Boil pasta in salted water.
Melt butter in a pan and sauté chopped onion.
Add peas and cook until tender.
Cut prosciutto into strips and add to the pan.
Season lightly with salt and pepper.
Pour in cream and stir gently.
Simmer for 2–3 minutes.
Reserve pasta water.
Drain pasta and add to the sauce.
Toss while adding pasta water for creaminess.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Rigatoni alla Zingara
instructions: Cut bell peppers into strips.
Heat olive oil and sauté garlic and chili flakes.
Add bell peppers and cook until softened.
Add prosciutto and stir for 1 minute.
Pour in tomato passata and simmer.
Add cream to create a rosy sauce.
Season with salt.
Boil rigatoni until al dente.
Reserve a cup of pasta water.
Drain pasta and mix with sauce.
Adjust consistency with pasta water.
Finish with parmigiano and serve.

recipes.name: Cima alla Genovese
instructions: Prepare a pocket in the veal breast (traditional cut).
Blanch spinach and squeeze out liquid.
Mix spinach, peas, chopped mortadella, eggs, breadcrumbs, and parmesan.
Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
Stuff the veal pocket with the mixture.
Sew the opening securely with kitchen twine.
Heat oil in a pot and brown the stuffed veal.
Add water or broth to partially cover.
Simmer for 1–1.5 hours on low heat.
Cool completely before slicing.
Serve in thin slices with cooking juices.

recipes.name: Cavatelli con Sugo di Pomodoro
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan.
Add lightly crushed garlic cloves.
Pour in tomato passata.
Season with salt.
Simmer for 10–12 minutes.
Boil cavatelli in salted water.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain and add pasta to the tomato sauce.
Toss gently to coat.
Add pasta water if needed for texture.
Finish with fresh basil and serve.

recipes.name: Pasta al Pomodoro Fresco
instructions: Score fresh tomatoes and blanch briefly.
Peel and chop tomatoes into cubes.
Heat olive oil in a pan.
Add lightly crushed garlic cloves.
Add chopped tomatoes and stir.
Season with salt and pepper.
Simmer 8–10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Boil spaghetti in salted water.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain pasta and add to the fresh sauce.
Mix gently and add pasta water if needed.
Finish with basil and serve.

recipes.name: Trofie al Pesto
instructions: Wash basil leaves and dry well.
Crush garlic and pine nuts in a mortar.
Add basil in batches and grind to a paste.
Mix in parmigiano and pecorino.
Stream olive oil until smooth.
Boil diced potatoes and green beans.
Add trofie to the same pot.
Cook until pasta is al dente.
Reserve some pasta water.
Drain and mix pasta with pesto off heat.
Add pasta water to loosen sauce.
Serve with extra cheese.

recipes.name: Strangozzi al Tartufo
instructions: Bring salted water to a boil.
Cook strangozzi until al dente.
Gently warm butter and olive oil in a pan.
Add crushed garlic and remove after 30 seconds.
Reserve pasta water.
Drain pasta and add to the butter mixture.
Toss well on low heat.
Grate fresh black truffle generously over pasta.
Add a spoon of pasta water for creaminess.
Stir in a little parmigiano.
Plate and finish with more truffle shavings.

recipes.name: Pasta alla Siciliana (Pasta con Melanzane)
instructions: Cube eggplants and salt them for 20 minutes.
Rinse and pat dry.
Fry eggplant cubes until golden.
Set aside on paper towels.
Sauté garlic in olive oil.
Add tomato sauce and simmer 8 minutes.
Boil pasta until al dente.
Reserve pasta water.
Add pasta to the sauce.
Add fried eggplants and toss.
Finish with ricotta salata and basil.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Paccheri al Ragù Napoletano
instructions: Brown beef and pork ribs in olive oil.
Remove meat and set aside.
Sauté chopped onion in the same pot.
Deglaze with red wine.
Add tomato passata and stir.
Return meat to the pot.
Simmer on very low heat for 2–3 hours.
Stir occasionally and adjust seasoning.
Remove meat (traditionally served separately).
Boil paccheri until al dente.
Mix pasta with the concentrated ragù sauce.
Serve with basil and parmigiano.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken cubes with soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and cornstarch for 20 minutes.
Mix light soy, dark soy, vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch with water to make the sauce.
Stir-fry dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns in hot oil until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until nearly cooked.
Add garlic, ginger, and spring onion whites, stir-fry briefly.
Pour in the sauce and stir until it thickens and coats the chicken.
Toss in roasted peanuts and remaining spring onion greens.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
instructions: Blanch cubed tofu in salted water for 1-2 minutes, then drain.
Stir-fry ground pork in oil until cooked and crispy.
Add doubanjiang and stir-fry until the oil turns red.
Add ginger, garlic, and fermented black beans, stir-fry until fragrant.
Pour in chicken stock and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer.
Gently add the tofu cubes. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Thicken the sauce with cornstarch slurry.
Finish with a generous sprinkle of ground Sichuan peppercorn and scallions.

recipes.name: Peking Duck
instructions: Inflate the skin away from the meat and blanch the duck with hot water.
Glaze the duck with a mixture of honey, maltose, and vinegar.
Let the duck dry in a cool, airy place for 24+ hours until the skin is taut.
Roast the duck hanging in an oven until the skin is crispy and deep amber.
Carve the duck, slicing the skin and meat together.
Serve with steamed Mandarin pancakes, hoisin sauce, spring onions, and cucumber.

recipes.name: Char Siu (Chinese BBQ Pork)
instructions: Cut pork into long strips.
Mix all marinade ingredients to form a paste.
Marinate the pork for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Roast the pork on a rack, basting occasionally with the marinade and honey.
Roast until cooked through and caramelized on the edges.
Let rest, then slice and serve over rice or noodles.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup
instructions: Bring stock to a boil in a pot.
Add wood ear mushrooms, shiitake mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and tofu. Simmer for 5 mins.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, and white pepper. Adjust to taste (it should be balanced).
Thicken the soup with cornstarch slurry to a velvety consistency.
Slowly drizzle in the beaten egg while stirring to create ribbons.
Finish with a drizzle of chili oil and sesame oil.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve hot.

recipes.name: Dumplings (Jiaozi)
instructions: Mix filling ingredients (pork, cabbage, chives, ginger, garlic, seasonings) in a bowl.
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of a dumpling wrapper.
Wet the edges of the wrapper and fold, pleating to seal.
To boil: Cook in simmering water until they float and the skin is tender (~5-7 mins).
To pan-fry (potstickers): Pan-fry until golden on the bottom, then add water and steam until cooked through.
Serve with a dipping sauce of soy sauce, vinegar, and chili oil.

recipes.name: Sweet and Sour Pork
instructions: Coat pork cubes in a batter of egg, flour, and cornstarch.
Deep-fry the pork until golden brown and crispy. Set aside.
In a separate wok, stir-fry bell peppers and onion for 1-2 minutes.
Add pineapple chunks and stir-fry briefly.
Add the sauce ingredients (ketchup, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, water) and bring to a boil.
Thicken the sauce with a cornstarch slurry.
Add the fried pork back into the wok and toss quickly to coat in the sauce.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
ingredients: Whole white fish (sea bass, tilapia, or snapper)
instructions: Clean the fish and make a few slashes on each side.
Place the fish on a plate and scatter half the ginger on top.
Steam over high heat for 8-12 minutes (depending on size) until cooked.
Remove from steamer and pour off any excess liquid.
Cover the fish with the remaining ginger and spring onions.
Heat cooking oil and sesame oil in a small pan until smoking.
Drizzle the hot oil over the ginger and scallions - it will sizzle.
Finish by pouring light soy sauce around the plate.

recipes.name: Dan Dan Noodles
ingredients: Sui Mi Ya Cai (Sichuan preserved vegetable)
instructions: Cook wheat noodles according to package instructions. Drain.
Stir-fry ground pork until crispy. Add Sui Mi Ya Cai and stir-fry briefly.
In serving bowls, mix soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil, peanut paste, and Sichuan peppercorn powder.
Add a splash of hot chicken stock to the sauce mixture.
Place the cooked noodles in the bowl on top of the sauce.
Top with the crispy pork mixture, minced garlic, and chopped scallions.
Toss everything together thoroughly before eating.

recipes.name: Scrambled Eggs with Tomatoes
instructions: Beat eggs with a pinch of salt.
Cut tomatoes into wedges.
Scramble the eggs in hot oil until just set. Remove from wok.
In the same wok, stir-fry tomatoes until they start to break down and become saucy.
Add a pinch of sugar and a splash of ketchup (if using).
Return the scrambled eggs to the wok and mix gently with the tomatoes.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Twice-Cooked Pork (Hui Guo Rou)
instructions: Boil the whole pork belly in water for 20-25 minutes until cooked through. Let cool, then slice thinly.
Stir-fry the pork slices in a wok until they curl and become slightly crispy. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry doubanjiang until the oil turns red.
Add fermented black beans, ginger, and garlic, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add the green peppers and leeks, and stir-fry for a minute.
Return the pork to the wok. Add soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and sweet wheat paste.
Stir-fry everything together quickly until well-coated and heated through.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Clay Pot Rice (Bao Zai Fan)
instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes, then drain.
Marinate chicken with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.
Place rice in a clay pot with water (ratio 1:1.2). Bring to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce heat to low. Arrange sausage, chicken, mushrooms, and ginger on top of the rice.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes until rice is cooked and a crispy crust forms at the bottom.
Drizzle dark soy sauce and sesame oil over the top.
Garnish with scallions, stir gently, and serve hot from the pot.

recipes.name: Lion's Head Meatballs (Shi Zi Tou)
instructions: Mix ground pork, water chestnuts, ginger, scallions, soy sauce, wine, and cornstarch. Form into large, fist-sized meatballs.
Pan-fry the meatballs in oil until all sides are golden brown.
Line a pot with Napa cabbage leaves.
Place the seared meatballs on top of the cabbage.
Add soy sauces, Shaoxing wine, rock sugar, and enough water to cover halfway.
Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 1-1.5 hours until very tender.
Serve the meatballs and cabbage with the reduced braising liquid.

recipes.name: Sichuan Boiled Fish (Shui Zhu Yu)
instructions: Marinate fish slices in egg white, cornstarch, Shaoxing wine, and salt.
Stir-fry doubanjiang in oil until fragrant and the oil turns red.
Add ginger, garlic, and half of the Sichuan peppercorns; stir-fry.
Add water or stock and bring to a boil to create the soup base.
Add bean sprouts and blanch until just tender. Remove and place in a serving bowl.
Gently poach the fish slices in the simmering soup until they turn white and float.
Pour the fish and soup over the bean sprouts.
Garnish with the remaining dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns. Heat oil until smoking and pour it over the top to sizzle and release the aromas.

recipes.name: Scallion Pancakes (Cong You Bing)
instructions: Mix flour with boiling water to form a dough. Knead until smooth, cover, and rest for 30+ minutes.
Divide dough into portions. Roll each portion into a thin circle.
Brush the surface with sesame oil, sprinkle with salt and a generous amount of chopped scallions.
Roll the circle into a long cylinder, then coil the cylinder into a round spiral. Flatten the spiral with a rolling pin into a pancake.
Pan-fry in oil over medium heat until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Cut into wedges and serve hot.

recipes.name: White Cut Chicken (Bai Qie Ji)
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil with ginger and scallions.
Submerge the chicken in the water, return to a boil, then immediately reduce to a bare simmer.
Poach the chicken for about 30-40 minutes (depending on size), until just cooked through.
While cooking, skim off any impurities.
Once cooked, remove the chicken and plunge it into an ice bath to stop the cooking and tighten the skin.
Let the chicken cool completely, then chop through the bone into serving pieces.
Serve at room temperature with a dipping sauce of soy sauce, minced ginger, and scallions.

recipes.name: Fish-Fragrant Eggplant (Yu Xiang Qie Zi)
instructions: Cut eggplant into batons. Soak in salted water to prevent browning.
Mix soy sauce, sugar, vinegar, and cornstarch with water to make the 'fish-fragrant' sauce.
Stir-fry doubanjiang in oil until the oil turns red.
Add ginger, garlic, and scallion whites, and stir-fry until fragrant.
Drain the eggplant and add to the wok. Stir-fry until it softens.
Add the sauce mixture and stir until the sauce thickens and coats the eggplant.
Garnish with scallion greens and serve.

recipes.name: Wonton Soup (Hun Tun Tang)
instructions: Mix pork, shrimp, wine, soy sauce, sesame oil, and ginger to make the filling.
Place a small amount of filling in the center of a wonton wrapper. Moisten edges and fold to seal, creating a bundle.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook wontons in batches until they float, about 5 minutes.
In a separate pot, bring chicken stock to a simmer. Season with salt.
Blanch bok choy in the stock or the wonton water until tender.
Place cooked wontons and bok choy in a bowl. Ladle the hot stock over them.
Garnish with nori strips or chopped scallions.

recipes.name: Yangzhou Fried Rice (Yang Zhou Chao Fan)
instructions: Beat the eggs. Scramble them in a hot wok with oil until just set. Remove and set aside.
Stir-fry the shrimp until pink. Remove and set aside.
Add a bit more oil to the wok. Add the rice, breaking up any clumps.
Stir-fry the rice for a few minutes until heated through.
Add the peas, carrots, and char siu. Stir-fry to combine.
Return the eggs and shrimp to the wok.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and white pepper. Toss everything together.
Stir in the chopped scallions and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Steamed Spareribs with Black Bean Sauce (Dou Chi Zheng Pai Gu)
ingredients: Pork spareribs, chopped into small pieces
Fermented black beans, rinsed and chopped
instructions: Soak the chopped ribs in water for 10 minutes to draw out blood, then drain and pat dry.
Mix the ribs with cornstarch until lightly coated.
Add the chopped black beans, garlic, chili, soy sauce, oyster sauce, wine, sugar, and oil. Mix well.
Let the ribs marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Arrange the ribs on a plate in a single layer.
Steam over high heat for 18-25 minutes, or until the ribs are fully cooked and tender.
Garnish with fresh scallions or cilantro and serve immediately with rice.

recipes.name: Red Braised Pork Belly (Hong Shao Rou)
instructions: Blanch pork belly cubes in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a wok, add rock sugar, and melt until amber-colored.
Add pork belly and stir-fry until coated and lightly browned.
Add Shaoxing wine, soy sauces, ginger, scallions, and star anise.
Add enough hot water to just cover the pork.
Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 1-1.5 hours until tender.
Uncover and increase heat to reduce the sauce to a thick, glossy glaze.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Ants Climbing a Tree (Ma Yi Shang Shu)
instructions: Soak vermicelli noodles in warm water until soft, then drain.
Stir-fry ground pork in oil until crispy and cooked through.
Add doubanjiang and stir-fry until oil turns red.
Add ginger and garlic, stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken stock, soy sauces, and bring to a simmer.
Add drained noodles and cook until they absorb most of the liquid.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve.

recipes.name: Sichuan Cold Noodles (Liang Mian)
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions. Rinse with cold water and drain.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil, sugar, and Sichuan peppercorn powder to make the sauce.
Place cold noodles in a bowl. Top with cucumber and carrot strips.
Pour the sauce over the noodles.
Garnish with minced garlic, crushed peanuts, and scallions.
Toss everything together thoroughly before eating.

recipes.name: Buddha's Delight (Luóhàn Zhāi)
instructions: Soak all dried ingredients (mushrooms, lily flowers, bean curd sticks) until soft. Reserve mushroom soaking liquid.
Stir-fry carrots and bamboo shoots in oil for 2 minutes.
Add all mushrooms, lily flowers, and tough vegetables. Stir-fry briefly.
Add the reserved mushroom liquid, soy sauce, and vegetarian oyster sauce.
Simmer covered for 15 minutes.
Add tofu puffs, bean curd sticks, and delicate vegetables like snow peas and Napa cabbage.
Cook for another 5-10 minutes until all vegetables are tender but not mushy.
Finish with a drizzle of sesame oil and serve.

recipes.name: Cantonese Steamed Chicken with Mushrooms
instructions: Soak dried mushrooms until soft, then slice. Reserve soaking liquid.
Marinate chicken with soy sauce, oyster sauce, wine, cornstarch, and sesame oil for 20 minutes.
Mix in the sliced mushrooms and ginger with the marinated chicken.
Arrange the mixture on a heatproof plate.
Steam over high heat for 15-20 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Three Cup Chicken (San Bei Ji)
instructions: Blanch chicken pieces in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain.
Heat sesame oil in a clay pot or wok. Stir-fry ginger and garlic until fragrant.
Add chicken and stir-fry until surface is cooked.
Add soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and rock sugar. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until chicken is tender.
Uncover, increase heat to reduce the sauce until it thickens and glazes the chicken.
Turn off heat, stir in fresh Thai basil leaves and whole chilies (if using).
Serve immediately from the clay pot.

recipes.name: Xinjiang Big Plate Chicken (Da Pan Ji)
ingredients: Hand-pulled noodles or wide flat noodles
instructions: Stir-fry chicken pieces in oil until skin is golden. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry dried chilies, Sichuan peppercorns, cumin, ginger, and garlic until fragrant.
Return chicken to wok. Add soy sauces and stir to coat.
Add enough water to cover the chicken. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Add potato cubes and continue to simmer for another 15-20 minutes until potatoes are tender.
Add bell peppers and onions, cook for 3-5 more minutes until slightly softened.
In the last few minutes, add hand-pulled noodles to the sauce to cook.
Serve everything together in a large plate or bowl.

recipes.name: Salted Egg Yolk Prawns
ingredients: Salted duck egg yolks, cooked and mashed
instructions: Coat prawns lightly in cornstarch. Pan-fry in oil until cooked and crispy. Set aside.
In a clean wok, melt butter. Add the mashed salted egg yolks.
Stir-fry the yolks on low heat until they become sandy and bubbly.
Add a splash of evaporated milk, sugar, and chilies (if using).
Add the cooked prawns and curry leaves back to the wok.
Toss vigorously until the prawns are evenly coated with the salted egg yolk sauce.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Chinese Broccoli with Garlic (Gai Lan)
instructions: Wash Chinese broccoli. Cut thick stems in half lengthwise for even cooking.
Blanch the broccoli in boiling water for 1-2 minutes until bright green. Drain.
Heat oil in a wok. Stir-fry ginger and garlic until fragrant.
Add the blanched broccoli and stir-fry quickly for 1 minute.
Add Shaoxing wine around the sides of the wok.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and a pinch of sugar. Toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cantonese Wonton Noodle Soup (Won Ton Mein)
instructions: Make a rich broth by simmering chicken bones and dried flounder for several hours. Strain.
Cook egg noodles according to package instructions. Rinse briefly with cold water to stop cooking.
Cook wontons in boiling water until they float, about 5 minutes.
Blanch bok choy in the same water.
Place cooked noodles in a bowl. Top with wontons and bok choy.
Ladle the hot, clear broth over everything.
Garnish with chopped scallions.

recipes.name: Sichuan Dandan Noodles (Vegetarian Version)
ingredients: Textured vegetable protein (TVP) or shiitake mushrooms, minced
Sui Mi Ya Cai (Sichuan preserved vegetable)
instructions: Cook wheat noodles according to package instructions. Drain.
Stir-fry TVP or minced mushrooms until crispy. Add Sui Mi Ya Cai and stir-fry briefly.
In serving bowls, mix soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil, peanut paste, and Sichuan peppercorn powder.
Add a splash of hot vegetable stock to the sauce mixture.
Place the cooked noodles in the bowl on top of the sauce.
Top with the crispy vegetarian 'meat' mixture, minced garlic, and chopped scallions.
Toss everything together thoroughly before eating.

recipes.name: Steamed Egg (Zheng Shui Dan)
instructions: Beat eggs gently until uniform, trying not to create too many bubbles.
Add warm water or stock at a 1:1.5 ratio (egg:liquid). Add salt and pepper. Mix.
Strain the egg mixture through a fine sieve into a heatproof bowl to remove bubbles and chalaza.
Cover the bowl with a plate or plastic wrap to prevent steam water from dripping in.
Steam over medium-low heat for 12-15 minutes until set but still jiggly.
Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil, and garnish with scallions.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cumin Lamb (Zi Ran Yang Rou)
ingredients: Lamb leg or shoulder, thinly sliced
instructions: Marinate lamb slices with soy sauce and Shaoxing wine for 15 minutes.
Stir-fry lamb in very hot oil until browned but not overcooked. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry cumin seeds, dried chilies, and Sichuan peppercorns until fragrant.
Add onion, ginger, and garlic. Stir-fry until onion is translucent.
Return lamb to the wok. Add cumin powder and toss to combine.
Stir-fry for another minute until everything is heated through.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chinese Congee (Bai Zhou)
instructions: Rinse rice until water runs clear.
Combine rice and water in a large pot at a 1:8 to 1:10 ratio (rice:water).
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a very low simmer.
Cook for 1-1.5 hours, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the rice breaks down and the congee reaches a porridge-like consistency.
Season with salt and white pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with ginger, scallions, a drizzle of sesame oil, and pieces of you tiao.

recipes.name: Stinky Tofu (Chou Dou Fu)
instructions: Purchase pre-fermented stinky tofu from an Asian market. (Homemade fermentation takes weeks).
Drain the tofu from its brine.
Heat oil for deep-frying to 350°F (175°C).
Carefully lower the tofu blocks into the hot oil.
Fry until the exterior is golden brown and very crispy.
Remove and drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately with chili sauce, pickled vegetables, and fresh cilantro.

recipes.name: Drunken Chicken (Zui Ji)
instructions: Poach chicken with ginger and scallions in salted water until just cooked through.
Immediately plunge the cooked chicken into an ice bath to stop the cooking and tighten the skin.
Strain and reserve 1 cup of the poaching liquid. Let it cool completely.
Once the chicken and broth are cold, combine them in a container with Shaoxing wine and goji berries.
Ensure the chicken is fully submerged in the liquid.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours, preferably 2-3 days, to marinate.
Remove the chicken from the liquid, chop into pieces, and serve cold.

recipes.name: Sichuan Boiled Beef (Shui Zhu Niu Rou)
ingredients: Beef flank or sirloin, thinly sliced
instructions: Marinate beef slices in egg white, cornstarch, Shaoxing wine, and salt.
Stir-fry doubanjiang in oil until fragrant and the oil turns red.
Add ginger, garlic, and half of the Sichuan peppercorns; stir-fry.
Add water or stock and bring to a boil to create the soup base.
Add bean sprouts and celery and blanch until just tender. Remove and place in a serving bowl.
Gently poach the beef slices in the simmering soup until they change color.
Pour the beef and soup over the vegetables.
Garnish with the remaining dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns. Heat oil until smoking and pour it over the top to sizzle and release the aromas.

recipes.name: Turnip Cake (Lo Bak Go)
instructions: Stir-fry Chinese sausage, dried shrimp, and mushrooms until fragrant. Set aside.
Cook shredded daikon with a little water until translucent and soft. Do not drain the liquid.
Mix rice flour and tapioca starch. Gradually add the warm daikon and its cooking liquid to form a thick batter.
Stir in the cooked meats and mushrooms. Season with salt, sugar, and white pepper.
Pour the batter into a greased loaf pan. Smooth the top.
Steam for 45-60 minutes until a skewer inserted comes out clean.
Let cool completely, then refrigerate overnight to firm up.
Slice and pan-fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides. Serve with chili sauce or hoisin.

recipes.name: West Lake Beef Soup (Xi Hu Niu Rou Geng)
instructions: Bring chicken stock to a gentle simmer.
Add minced beef, breaking it up with a spoon.
Add tofu, soy sauce, and Shaoxing wine.
Thicken the soup with cornstarch slurry to a velvety consistency.
Slowly drizzle in the beaten egg while stirring to create ribbons.
Season with white pepper and a drizzle of sesame oil.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Dongpo Pork (Dong Po Rou)
instructions: Blanch the whole pork belly block in boiling water for 10 minutes. Remove and cool.
In a clay pot, line the bottom with scallions and ginger slices.
Place the pork belly, skin-side down, on top of the aromatics.
Add Shaoxing wine, soy sauces, and rock sugar around the pork.
Add enough hot water to almost cover the pork.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to the lowest possible setting.
Simmer covered for 2.5-3 hours, turning the pork halfway through.
Remove the lid, increase heat, and reduce the sauce until thick and glossy.
Serve the pork whole or in thick slices, spooned with the reduced sauce.

recipes.name: Tea Smoked Duck (Zhang Cha Ya)
instructions: Rub duck inside and out with Sichuan peppercorns, salt, and five-spice. Marinate for 24 hours.
Steam the marinated duck with ginger and scallions for 45 minutes until cooked.
Line a wok with foil. Mix rice, tea leaves, brown sugar, and spices. Place over heat.
Place a rack over the smoking mixture. Put the steamed duck on the rack.
Cover the wok tightly and smoke over medium heat for 15-20 minutes until the skin is amber.
Let duck rest, then chop through bone into pieces. Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Sichuan Pepper Chicken (Hua Jiao Ji)
instructions: Marinate chicken cubes with soy sauce, wine, and cornstarch for 15 minutes.
Stir-fry chicken in hot oil until cooked and slightly crispy. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry Sichuan peppercorns and dried chilies until very fragrant.
Add ginger, garlic, and scallion whites, stir-fry briefly.
Return chicken to the wok. Add a splash of soy sauce and a pinch of sugar.
Toss everything together until well-combined and heated through.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cantonese Soy Sauce Pan-Fried Noodles (Zi Sha Chao Mian)
instructions: Blanch fresh noodles in boiling water for 1 minute to separate. Drain well.
Heat oil in a hot wok or skillet. Spread noodles in a single layer and pan-fry until golden and crispy on one side. Flip and repeat. Remove and set aside.
Stir-fry meat until cooked. Add bean sprouts and scallions, stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add soy sauces, oyster sauce, and a pinch of sugar.
Return the crispy noodles to the wok. Toss everything together quickly to coat the noodles without making them soggy.
Finish with a drizzle of sesame oil and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Sour and Spicy Soup (Suan La Tang)
ingredients: Wood ear mushrooms, rehydrated and sliced
instructions: Bring stock to a boil in a pot.
Add meat, bamboo shoots, wood ear mushrooms, carrot, and tofu. Simmer for 5 mins.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, and a generous amount of white pepper.
Thicken the soup with cornstarch slurry to a velvety consistency.
Slowly drizzle in the beaten egg while stirring to create ribbons.
Finish with a drizzle of chili oil and sesame oil.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve hot.

recipes.name: Steamed Pork with Rice Powder (Fen Zheng Rou)
ingredients: Store-bought or homemade rice powder (米粉)
instructions: Slice pork belly into 1/4-inch thick pieces.
Marinate pork with doubanjiang, soy sauce, wine, ginger, garlic, and fermented black beans for 30 minutes.
Coat the marinated pork slices thoroughly with the rice powder.
Arrange the potato cubes at the bottom of a heatproof bowl.
Place the coated pork slices over the potatoes, overlapping slightly.
Steam over high heat for 1.5 hours until the pork is very tender and the fat has rendered.
Invert the bowl onto a serving plate so the potatoes are on top. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Gluten Balls (You Mian Jin)
instructions: Mix wheat gluten flour, a pinch of baking powder, and water to form a dough. Knead for 10 minutes.
Let the dough rest in a bowl of water for 1-2 hours.
Under running water, knead the dough to wash away the starch. What remains is a ball of raw gluten.
Tear the gluten into small balls or pieces.
Deep-fry the gluten balls in medium-hot oil until they puff up and are golden brown and crispy.
In a separate pot, simmer soy sauce, sugar, star anise, and water to make a braising liquid.
Add the fried gluten balls to the braising liquid and simmer for 15 minutes to absorb flavor.
Serve as a cold appetizer or use in other dishes like Buddha's Delight.

recipes.name: Beggar's Chicken (Jiao Hua Ji)
instructions: Marinate the whole chicken inside and out with soy sauce and Shaoxing wine for 1 hour.
Stuff the cavity with mushrooms, ham, bamboo shoots, ginger, and scallions.
Wrap the chicken first in soaked lotus leaves, then securely in aluminum foil or encase in a clay crust.
Bake in a low oven (300°F / 150°C) for 3-4 hours.
If using clay, crack it open at the table for presentation.
Unwrap the lotus leaves. The meat should be falling-off-the-bone tender.
Shred or chop the chicken and serve with the accumulated juices and stuffing.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Rice Cakes (Nian Gao) with Shanghai Greens
instructions: Soak dried rice cakes in warm water until softened, or use fresh/frozen.
Stir-fry pork until cooked. Add mushrooms and stir-fry.
Add bok choy and stir-fry until wilted.
Add rice cakes, soy sauces, wine, a pinch of sugar, and a splash of stock.
Stir-fry and cover briefly to allow the rice cakes to steam and become soft and chewy.
Uncover and continue to stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats the rice cakes.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Five Spice Tofu (Wu Dou Fu Gan)
instructions: Slice the pressed tofu into thick slices or triangles.
In a pot, combine soy sauces, star anise, five-spice powder, sugar, and enough water to cover the tofu.
Bring to a boil, then add the tofu slices.
Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Turn off heat and let the tofu cool in the braising liquid to absorb maximum flavor.
Serve at room temperature as an appetizer or side dish.

recipes.name: Chrysanthemum Fish (Ju Hua Yu)
ingredients: Whole white fish (bass or snapper), filleted and skinned
instructions: Score the fish fillets in a cross-hatch pattern, cutting deep but not through the skin, to create a 'chrysanthemum' pattern.
Marinate fish with ginger, scallions, wine, salt, and pepper for 15 minutes.
Coat the fish thoroughly and gently with cornstarch, getting into the cuts.
Deep-fry the fish, holding it by the tail first to open the 'flower', then fully submerging, until golden and crispy. Drain.
In a separate pan, make a sweet and sour sauce with ketchup, sugar, vinegar, and a little water. Thicken with cornstarch slurry.
Pour the sauce over the fried fish and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Sichuan Pickled Vegetables (Paocai)
instructions: Thoroughly clean and sterilize a pickling jar.
Bring distilled water to a boil with salt, stirring to dissolve. Let cool completely.
Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Air dry or pat thoroughly dry.
Place ginger and Sichuan peppercorns at the bottom of the jar.
Pack the vegetables tightly into the jar.
Pour the cooled brine over the vegetables, ensuring they are fully submerged. Add a splash of wine and some old brine if available.
Seal the jar and place it in a cool, dark place.
Ferment for 3-7 days, then transfer to the refrigerator. The pickles are ready to eat after a few days.

recipes.name: Cantonese Steamed Fish with Preserved Lemons
ingredients: Preserved lemon, pulp removed, rind julienned
instructions: Place fish on a heatproof plate. Scatter preserved lemon and half the ginger on top.
Steam over high heat for 8-10 minutes until cooked.
Remove from steamer and pour off excess liquid.
Cover the fish with the remaining ginger and scallions.
Heat cooking oil and sesame oil until smoking.
Drizzle the hot oil over the aromatics.
Finish by pouring light soy sauce around the plate and garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Lanzhou Hand-Pulled Beef Noodle Soup (Lan Zhou La Mian)
ingredients: Hand-pulled noodle dough (high-gluten flour, water, salt,蓬灰水)
instructions: Simmer beef bones and shank with spices (star anise, cinnamon, ginger, etc.) for 3-4 hours to make a clear broth. Skim constantly. Season with salt and white pepper.
Remove beef shank, slice thinly. Strain the broth.
Prepare noodle dough and rest. Repeatedly stretch and fold the dough to create the 'pull'.
Boil the hand-pulled noodles until cooked. Blanch daikon slices in the broth.
Place cooked noodles in a bowl. Top with sliced beef and blanched daikon.
Ladle the hot, clear broth over everything.
Garnish with cilantro and scallions. Serve with chili oil on the side.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Bitter Melon with Black Bean Sauce
ingredients: Fermented black beans, rinsed and chopped
instructions: Slice bitter melon and blanch in salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes to reduce bitterness. Drain.
Heat oil in a wok. Stir-fry black beans, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant.
Add the blanched bitter melon and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add soy sauce and a pinch of sugar to balance the bitterness.
Stir-fry for another minute until well-combined. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Cantonese Roast Duck (Siu Aap)
instructions: Blanch duck with hot water to tighten the skin.
Mix five-spice, soy sauces, hoisin, wine, and mashed bean curd to make a marinade. Rub inside the duck cavity along with ginger and scallions. Sew or skewer shut. Marinate overnight.
Mix maltose syrup with hot water and vinegar to make a glaze.
Pour hot water over the duck skin, then pat dry. Glaze the duck and let it dry in a cool place for several hours.
Roast the duck hanging in an oven, breast-side up, at 350°F (175°C) for 45-60 minutes.
Rest, then chop through the bone into pieces. Serve with the reserved marinade as a dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Steamed Taro Cake (Wu Tao Gou)
instructions: Stir-fry Chinese sausage, dried shrimp, and mushrooms until fragrant. Set aside.
Stir-fry taro cubes until slightly softened and fragrant.
Mix rice flour and tapioca starch with water to form a batter. Season with salt, sugar, pepper, and five-spice.
Stir the cooked ingredients and taro into the batter.
Pour the batter into a greased cake pan. Smooth the top.
Steam for 50-60 minutes until set and a skewer comes out clean.
Let cool completely before slicing. Serve as is or pan-fried.

recipes.name: Sichuan Mouth-Watering Chicken (Kou Shui Ji)
instructions: Poach chicken with ginger and scallions in water until just cooked.
Immediately plunge the chicken into an ice bath to stop the cooking.
Reserve 1/2 cup of the poaching liquid.
Once cool, shred the chicken by hand.
Mix the reserved poaching liquid with soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, chili oil, and Sichuan peppercorn powder to make the sauce.
Pour the sauce over the shredded chicken.
Top with minced garlic, crushed peanuts, and cilantro.
Toss gently before serving.

recipes.name: Fuqi Feipian (Husband and Wife Lung Slices)
instructions: Clean all offal thoroughly. Blanch in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain.
In a large pot, combine offal with Sichuan peppercorns, star anise, cinnamon, bay leaves, ginger, and scallions. Cover with water.
Simmer for 1.5-2 hours until very tender. Let the offal cool completely in the broth.
Remove offal and slice as thinly as possible.
Mix chili oil, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, and a few spoonfuls of the braising liquid to create the sauce.
Toss the sliced offal with the sauce.
Garnish with crushed peanuts and cilantro before serving.

recipes.name: Shanghai Pan-Fried Buns (Sheng Jian Bao)
instructions: Make a firm, leavened dough with flour, yeast, and water. Let it rise until doubled.
Make aspic by simmering pork skin, then chilling the broth until it sets. Dice into small cubes.
Mix ground pork with ginger, scallions, soy sauce, wine, sesame oil, sugar, and pepper. Fold in diced aspic.
Divide dough and roll into wrappers. Place filling in the center and pleat to form buns.
Pan-fry buns in oil until golden brown on the bottom.
Add water to the pan, cover, and steam until the water evaporates and the tops are cooked.
Uncover, drizzle with more oil, and fry until the bottoms are extra crispy.
Garnish with black sesame seeds and scallions. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Yunnan Steam Pot Chicken (Qi Guo Ji)
ingredients: Jinhua ham or Yunnan ham, sliced
instructions: Use a special Yunnan steam pot with a central chimney.
Place chicken pieces, ham, ginger, and scallions in the pot.
Fill the base of the steam pot with water.
Assemble the pot and steam over high heat for 2-3 hours.
The steam condenses and drips down the chimney, creating a clear, flavorful broth inside the pot with the chicken.
Do not open the lid during the steaming process.
Once done, season the broth and chicken with salt and white pepper.
Serve the chicken with the broth, garnished with goji berries.

recipes.name: Minced Pork Omelette (Rou Song Zheng Dan)
instructions: Beat eggs with a pinch of salt and white pepper.
Add water or stock at a 1:1.5 ratio (egg:liquid). Mix well.
Stir in the ground pork, breaking up any clumps.
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a heatproof bowl.
Cover the bowl with a plate or plastic wrap.
Steam over medium-low heat for 12-15 minutes until set.
Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil, and garnish with scallions.
Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Lotus Root with Scallions
ingredients: Lotus root, peeled and thinly sliced
instructions: Soak sliced lotus root in water with a splash of vinegar to prevent browning.
Blanch lotus root in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain.
Heat oil in a wok. Stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add lotus root and stir-fry on high heat for 2-3 minutes.
Add soy sauce and a pinch of sugar. Toss to combine.
Add scallions and stir-fry for another 30 seconds.
Serve immediately while still crisp.

recipes.name: Dezhou Braised Chicken (De Zhou Ba Ji)
instructions: Blanch the whole chicken in boiling water for 5 minutes. Remove.
Heat oil in a large pot and melt rock sugar until amber.
Add the chicken and turn to coat in the caramelized sugar.
Add soy sauces, spices, ginger, and scallions.
Add enough hot water to cover two-thirds of the chicken.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a bare simmer.
Braise for 2-3 hours, basting and turning occasionally, until the meat is falling-off-the-bone tender.
Let the chicken cool slightly in the broth before carefully removing to serve.

recipes.name: Eight Treasure Rice (Ba Bao Fan)
ingredients: Dried fruits (raisins, red dates, dried longans)
instructions: Soak glutinous rice for at least 4 hours, then steam until cooked.
Mix the hot steamed rice with sugar and lard/oil.
Soak dried fruits until softened. Pit the red dates.
Grease a bowl. Arrange the 'eight treasures' (fruits, nuts) in a decorative pattern on the bottom.
Carefully press a layer of the sweetened rice over the pattern.
Create a well in the center and fill with red bean paste.
Cover the bean paste with the remaining rice, pressing down firmly.
Steam the assembled bowl for 1 hour. Invert onto a plate to serve warm.

recipes.name: Sichuan Green Bean Jelly (Liang Fen)
instructions: Mix mung bean starch with water at a 1:6 ratio (starch:water).
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture becomes thick and translucent.
Pour into a greased container and let cool completely, then refrigerate until set firm.
Cut the set jelly into thick strips or noodles.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, chili oil, and Sichuan peppercorn powder for the sauce.
Place the jelly strips in a bowl. Pour the sauce over them.
Top with minced garlic, scallions, and cilantro.
Toss gently before serving.

recipes.name: Cantonese Beef Chow Fun (Gon Chow Ngau Ho)
instructions: Marinate beef slices with a pinch of baking soda, soy sauce, wine, and cornstarch.
Separate the rice noodles if they are stuck together.
Heat a wok until smoking hot. Add oil and sear the beef quickly. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, add more oil. Stir-fry the rice noodles until heated through and slightly charred.
Push noodles to one side. Add bean sprouts and scallions, stir-fry briefly.
Add both soy sauces and oyster sauce directly into the wok.
Return beef to the wok. Toss everything together over high heat until well-combined.
Serve immediately, seeking the 'wok hei' (breath of the wok) flavor.

recipes.name: Chinese Pumpkin Pancakes (Nan Gua Bing)
instructions: Steam pumpkin until very soft. Mash it into a puree.
Mix the warm pumpkin puree with glutinous rice flour and sugar to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough and shape into small, flat pancakes.
Coat both sides of the pancakes with white sesame seeds.
Pan-fry in a little oil over medium heat until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Hainanese Chicken Rice (Hainan Ji Fan)
instructions: Poach the whole chicken in a pot of salted water with ginger and scallions until just cooked. Immediately plunge into ice water.
Render chicken fat in a pot. Sauté minced ginger and garlic in the fat until fragrant.
Add washed rice and stir to coat. Transfer to a rice cooker.
Add chicken stock (from poaching) and pandan leaves to the rice cooker. Cook the rice.
Chop the cooled chicken through the bone into serving pieces.
Serve chicken over the fragrant rice, with sliced cucumber and cilantro.
Provide dipping sauces: light soy with sesame oil, chili sauce, and minced ginger.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Pea Shoots with Garlic (Suan Rong Dou Miao)
instructions: Wash pea shoots thoroughly and drain well.
Heat oil in a very hot wok. Add minced garlic and stir-fry for 10 seconds until fragrant.
Add the pea shoots and stir-fry vigorously for 1-2 minutes until they wilt.
Season with salt and a tiny pinch of sugar to balance flavor.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Braised Pork Balls in Brown Sauce (Hong Shao Shi Zi Tou)
instructions: Mix ground pork, water chestnuts, ginger, scallions, soy sauce, wine, and cornstarch. Form into large meatballs.
Pan-fry the meatballs in oil until all sides are golden brown.
In a pot, combine soy sauces, rock sugar, and Shaoxing wine. Add the meatballs.
Add enough water to come halfway up the meatballs.
Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 40-50 minutes until cooked through.
In the last 10 minutes, add bok choy to the pot to steam.
Serve meatballs and bok choy with the reduced braising sauce.

recipes.name: Sichuan Numbing and Hot Tofu (Ma La Dou Fu)
instructions: Blanch cubed tofu in salted water for 1-2 minutes, then drain.
Stir-fry doubanjiang in oil until the oil turns red.
Add dried chilies, Sichuan peppercorns, ginger, and garlic, stir-fry until fragrant.
Pour in vegetable stock and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer.
Gently add the tofu cubes. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Thicken the sauce slightly with cornstarch slurry.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve.

recipes.name: Cantonese Lobster with Ginger and Scallions
instructions: Dispatch the lobster humanely. Chop the shell and meat into pieces. Lightly coat in cornstarch.
Stir-fry the lobster pieces in hot oil until the shell turns red. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry ginger, garlic, and the white parts of the scallions until fragrant.
Return lobster to the wok. Add Shaoxing wine around the sides.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and a pinch of sugar. Toss to combine.
Add a splash of water, cover, and steam for 2-3 minutes until the lobster is cooked through.
Add the green parts of the scallions, toss, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chinese Walrimp Chicken (Ge Da Tang)
instructions: Mix flour and water to form a firm dough. Rest for 30 minutes.
Mix filling: pork, cabbage, ginger, scallions, soy sauce, sesame oil.
Roll the dough into a long rope. Tear off small, uneven pieces ("ge da").
Flatten each piece of dough in your palm and place a small amount of filling in the center. Pinch closed to form irregular dumplings.
Bring chicken stock to a boil. Add the dumplings and cook until they float.
Add leafy greens and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Season the soup with salt and white pepper.
Serve the dumplings and greens in the hot broth.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Chinese Long Beans with Minced Pork
ingredients: Chinese long beans, cut into segments
Fermented black beans, rinsed and chopped
instructions: Stir-fry long beans in oil until slightly wrinkled and tender. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, stir-fry ground pork until cooked and crispy.
Add ginger, garlic, and fermented black beans. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Return long beans to the wok.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and a pinch of sugar.
Stir-fry everything together until well-combined and heated through.
Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Osmanthus Lotus Root Stuffed with Sticky Rice (Gui Hua Nuo Mi Ou)
instructions: Soak glutinous rice for at least 4 hours.
Peel lotus root. Cut off one end as a cap, keeping it attached.
Stuff the lotus root cavities tightly with the soaked glutinous rice.
Replace the 'cap' and secure with toothpicks.
Place the stuffed lotus root in a pot with water, rock sugar, and red dates (if using).
Simmer for 1.5-2 hours until the lotus root is very tender and the rice is cooked.
Let the lotus root cool in the syrup, then remove and slice into rounds.
Reduce the cooking syrup with osmanthus flowers and a little honey. Pour over the slices to serve.

recipes.name: Sichuan Dry-Fried Green Beans (Gan Bian Si Ji Dou)
instructions: Stir-fry green beans in a dry wok (no oil) over medium heat until they are wrinkled and slightly scorched. Remove and set aside.
Add oil to the wok. Stir-fry ground pork until crispy.
Add dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns, stir-fry until fragrant.
Add ya cai, ginger, and garlic, stir-fry briefly.
Return green beans to the wok.
Add soy sauce, wine, and a pinch of sugar. Toss to combine.
Stir-fry for another minute until everything is heated through.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Crossing the Bridge Noodles (Guo Qiao Mi Xian)
instructions: Simmer chicken and pork bones with Yunnan ham for 3-4 hours to create a rich, oily broth. Skim constantly.
Strain the broth. It must be piping hot when served.
Arrange raw meat slices, fish slices, quail eggs, and vegetables on separate plates.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions and divide into large bowls.
Bring the boiling broth to the table in a covered pot.
Uncover the pot and quickly add the raw ingredients one by one, starting with meats, then eggs, then vegetables.
The hot broth will cook the ingredients instantly.
Add noodles to the bowl, pour the broth with cooked ingredients over them, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chairman Mao's Red-Braised Pork (Hong Shao Rou)
instructions: Blanch pork belly cubes in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a wok, add rock sugar, and melt until amber-colored.
Add pork belly and stir-fry until coated and lightly browned.
Add Shaoxing wine, soy sauces, ginger, scallions, star anise, and dried chilies.
Add enough hot water to just cover the pork.
Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 1-1.5 hours until tender.
Uncover and increase heat to reduce the sauce to a thick, glossy glaze.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Cantonese Deep-Fried Squid (Zha You Yu)
ingredients: Salt and pepper mix for dipping
instructions: Cut cleaned squid into rings or leave as scored tubes.
Mix flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, pepper, and five-spice powder.
Gradually add water to form a smooth, thick batter.
Heat oil for deep-frying to 350°F (175°C).
Dip squid pieces into the batter, letting excess drip off.
Fry in batches until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately with a simple salt and white pepper mixture for dipping.

recipes.name: Sichuan Water Boiled Beef (Shui Zhu Niu Rou)
