instructions: Marinate beef slices in egg white, cornstarch, and wine.
Stir-fry doubanjiang in oil until fragrant and oil turns red.
Add ginger, garlic, and half the Sichuan peppercorns; stir-fry.
Add water and bring to a boil to create soup base.
Add vegetables and blanch until tender. Remove and place in serving bowl.
Gently poach beef slices in simmering soup until they change color.
Pour beef and soup over vegetables.
Garnish with remaining chilies and Sichuan peppercorns. Heat oil until smoking and pour over to sizzle.

recipes.name: Steamed Pork with Salted Fish (Xian Yu Zheng Rou Pian)
instructions: Soak salted fish briefly if very salty, then cut into small pieces.
Marinate pork slices with soy sauce, wine, sugar, pepper, and sesame oil for 15 minutes.
Arrange pork on a plate and scatter salted fish and ginger on top.
Steam over high heat for 15-20 minutes until pork is cooked through.
Garnish with chopped scallions and serve with plenty of rice.

recipes.name: Chinese Hot Pot (Huo Guo)
instructions: Prepare two broths: one spicy (with chili oil and Sichuan peppercorns) and one clear.
Arrange all raw ingredients on platters around the hot pot.
Bring broths to a rolling boil in the divided hot pot.
Each person cooks their own ingredients in the simmering broth.
Make dipping sauces with sesame paste, soy sauce, garlic, cilantro, etc.
Cook meat briefly until just done, vegetables until tender.
Noodles are usually added at the end to enjoy the enriched broth.
Eat communally over 1-2 hours.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Chinese Yam with Wood Ear Mushrooms
instructions: Soak wood ear mushrooms until soft, then slice.
Blanch Chinese yam and carrot slices in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain.
Heat oil in wok. Stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add wood ear mushrooms and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add blanched yam and carrots, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add cucumber slices and stir-fry briefly.
Season with soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Cantonese Steamed Fish Head with Chopped Chili (Duo Jiao Zheng Yu Tou)
ingredients: Fish head (bighead carp or similar), split
Fermented black beans, rinsed and chopped
instructions: Clean fish head and place on heatproof plate.
Mix fermented black beans, chilies, garlic, and ginger. Spread over fish head.
Drizzle with Shaoxing wine and a pinch of sugar.
Steam over high heat for 12-15 minutes until cooked through.
Pour soy sauce around the plate.
Garnish with chopped scallions.
Heat oil until smoking and pour over the fish head to sizzle.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Shanghai Smoked Fish (Xun Yu)
instructions: Cut fish into thick slices. Marinate with ginger and scallions for 30 minutes.
Deep-fry fish pieces until golden brown and crispy. Drain.
In a separate pot, combine soy sauces, wine, rock sugar, and spices with water.
Simmer the braising liquid for 15 minutes to develop flavor.
Add fried fish pieces to the braising liquid and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove fish and let cool completely in the liquid.
Serve at room temperature as a cold appetizer.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Clams with Black Bean Sauce
ingredients: Fresh clams, soaked to remove sand
Fermented black beans, rinsed and chopped
instructions: Soak clams in salted water for 1-2 hours to remove sand. Rinse thoroughly.
Heat oil in a hot wok. Stir-fry black beans, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant.
Add clams and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add Shaoxing wine around the sides of the wok, then cover to steam for 3-4 minutes until clams open.
Discard any clams that don't open.
Add soy sauce, sugar, and scallions. Toss to combine.
Thicken the sauce slightly with cornstarch slurry.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chinese Braised Bamboo Shoots (You Men Sun)
instructions: If using fresh bamboo shoots, boil in water for 20 minutes to remove bitterness. Canned can be used directly.
Heat oil in a wok. Stir-fry bamboo shoots for 2-3 minutes.
Add soy sauces, sugar, and enough stock to barely cover the bamboo shoots.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until tender and liquid is reduced.
Garnish with chopped scallions and a drizzle of sesame oil.
Serve hot or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Cantonese Sweet and Sour Pork (Gu Lao Rou)
instructions: Coat pork cubes in batter of egg, flour, and cornstarch.
Deep-fry pork until golden brown and crispy. Set aside.
In separate wok, stir-fry bell peppers and onion for 1-2 minutes.
Add pineapple and stir-fry briefly.
Add sauce ingredients (vinegar, sugar, ketchup, soy sauce, water) and bring to boil.
Thicken sauce with cornstarch slurry.
Add fried pork back to wok and toss quickly to coat.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Steamed Eggplant with Garlic Sauce (Suan Rong Qie Zi)
instructions: Cut eggplant into long strips and place on heatproof plate.
Steam over high heat for 10-12 minutes until very tender.
While eggplant steams, mix soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, and minced garlic to make sauce.
Once eggplant is cooked, drain any excess water.
Pour the garlic sauce over the steamed eggplant.
Garnish with chopped scallions and cilantro.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Milk (Zha Niu Nai)
instructions: Mix milk, cornstarch, sugar, and custard powder in a pot.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens to a paste.
Pour into greased tray and refrigerate for 3-4 hours until set firm.
Cut set milk into rectangular blocks.
Make batter with flour, baking powder, and water.
Dip milk blocks into batter, coating completely.
Deep-fry until golden brown and crispy outside.
Serve immediately while hot and crispy.

recipes.name: Sichuan Spicy Wontons (Hong You Chao Shou)
instructions: Mix pork with ginger, scallions, soy sauce, and sesame oil for filling.
Wrap filling in wonton wrappers, creating simple bundles.
Boil wontons until they float and are cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Mix chili oil, soy sauce, vinegar, Sichuan peppercorn powder, garlic, and sugar for sauce.
Drain cooked wontons and place in serving bowl.
Pour the spicy sauce over the wontons.
Garnish with additional scallions and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Braised Tofu with Mushrooms (Dong Gu Shao Dou Fu)
instructions: Pan-fry tofu cubes until golden on all sides. Set aside.
Stir-fry mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and carrots for 2-3 minutes.
Add vegetable stock, soy sauce, vegetarian oyster sauce, and sugar.
Add fried tofu and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add snow peas and cook for 2 more minutes.
Thicken sauce with cornstarch slurry.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Cantonese Steamed Minced Pork with Salted Egg (Xian Dan Zheng Rou Bing)
instructions: Separate salted egg: chop white, keep yolk whole.
Mix pork with ginger, scallions, soy sauce, wine, sugar, pepper, cornstarch, and chopped egg white.
Press mixture into a shallow bowl, creating a well in the center.
Place the whole salted egg yolk in the well.
Steam over high heat for 15-20 minutes until pork is cooked through.
Drizzle with sesame oil and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Stir-Fried Chinese Lettuce with Oyster Sauce
instructions: Wash and cut lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in very hot wok. Stir-fry garlic for 10 seconds until fragrant.
Add lettuce and stir-fry vigorously for 1-2 minutes until wilted but still crisp.
Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, and pinch of sugar.
Toss to combine and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chinese Almond Float (Xing Ren Dou Fu)
instructions: Bloom gelatin in cold water according to package directions.
Heat milk with sugar until sugar dissolves. Do not boil.
Remove from heat and stir in bloomed gelatin until completely dissolved.
Add almond extract to taste.
Pour into mold and refrigerate for 4+ hours until set.
Cut into cubes and serve chilled with mixed fruits and syrup.
Garnish with lychees and cherries.
Serve as a refreshing dessert.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
instructions: Sauté bacon until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Brown beef cubes in bacon fat in batches. Set aside.
Sauté carrots, onions, and mushrooms until browned.
Add tomato paste and flour, cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze with red wine, scraping up browned bits.
Return beef and bacon to pot. Add stock, garlic, and herbs.
Cover and simmer on low heat for 2.5-3 hours until beef is tender.
Adjust seasoning and serve with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

recipes.name: Wiener Schnitzel
instructions: Pound veal slices until very thin (about 1/4 inch).
Season with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, then beaten eggs, then breadcrumbs.
Heat butter and oil in large pan until foaming.
Fry schnitzels for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges and potato salad.

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
instructions: Sauté bacon until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Brown chicken pieces in bacon fat. Remove and set aside.
Sauté mushrooms and pearl onions until browned.
Add tomato paste and flour, cook for 1 minute.
Deglaze with brandy, then add red wine.
Return chicken and bacon to pot. Add stock and herbs.
Simmer covered for 1.5-2 hours until chicken is tender.
Serve with crusty bread or mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Spanish Paella
instructions: Heat olive oil in paella pan. Brown chicken and rabbit.
Add onions and garlic, sauté until soft.
Add grated tomato and cook until darkened.
Add paprika and rice, stir to coat.
Add hot stock and saffron. Do not stir from this point.
Arrange seafood and beans on top.
Cook over medium heat for 20-25 minutes until rice is done.
Let rest for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Greek Moussaka
instructions: Salt eggplant slices and let drain for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Fry eggplant and potato slices until golden. Set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic. Add meat and brown.
Add tomato paste, wine, spices, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Whisk in milk until thick. Add nutmeg, cheese, and egg yolks.
Layer potatoes, eggplant, meat sauce in baking dish.
Top with béchamel sauce.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes until golden. Let rest 15 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: German Sauerbraten
instructions: Combine vinegar, wine, vegetables, and spices for marinade.
Marinate beef for 3-5 days in refrigerator, turning daily.
Remove beef from marinade and pat dry. Strain and reserve marinade.
Brown beef on all sides in butter.
Add reserved marinade and simmer covered for 2.5-3 hours.
Remove beef. Strain cooking liquid.
Make sauce: thicken liquid with crushed gingerbread and flour. Add raisins.
Slice beef and serve with sauce, potato dumplings, and red cabbage.

recipes.name: French Onion Soup
instructions: Melt butter in heavy pot. Add onions and cook slowly over low heat for 45 minutes until caramelized.
Add wine and scrape up browned bits. Reduce by half.
Add stock, bay leaf, and thyme. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toast baguette slices.
Ladle soup into ovenproof bowls. Top with toast and grated cheese.
Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Hungarian Goulash
instructions: Brown beef in lard. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onions until soft. Remove from heat.
Add paprika and caraway seeds, stir quickly.
Return beef to pot. Add garlic, peppers, tomatoes, and tomato paste.
Add enough stock to cover. Simmer for 1.5 hours.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook for 30 more minutes until tender.
Adjust seasoning. Serve with crusty bread or egg noodles.

recipes.name: Swedish Meatballs (Köttbullar)
instructions: Soak breadcrumbs in milk.
Mix meats, onion, egg, spices, and breadcrumb mixture.
Form into small meatballs.
Brown meatballs in butter in batches. Set aside.
Make sauce: add flour to pan, cook 1 minute. Whisk in stock and cream.
Return meatballs to sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with mashed potatoes, lingonberry jam, and pickled cucumber.

recipes.name: Portuguese Bacalhau à Brás
instructions: Soak salt cod in water for 24-48 hours, changing water several times.
Shred the desalted cod, removing bones and skin.
Fry potato sticks until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add shredded cod and cook for 5 minutes.
Add fried potatoes and mix well.
Pour beaten eggs over mixture and stir until eggs are softly set.
Garnish with olives and parsley. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Belgian Moules Frites
instructions: Soak mussels in cold water. Scrub and remove beards. Discard any open ones.
Sauté shallots and garlic in butter until soft.
Add wine, bay leaf, and thyme. Bring to boil.
Add mussels, cover, and steam for 5-7 minutes until they open.
Discard any unopened mussels.
Stir in cream and parsley.
Meanwhile, fry potatoes until golden and crispy.
Serve mussels in broth with fries and mayonnaise.

recipes.name: Austrian Apple Strudel (Apfelstrudel)
instructions: Toast breadcrumbs in butter until golden. Set aside.
Mix apples with sugar, cinnamon, raisins, walnuts, and lemon juice.
Stretch dough on floured cloth until paper-thin.
Sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
Arpple filling along one edge.
Using cloth, roll strudel away from you.
Transfer to baking sheet. Brush with melted butter.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 35-45 minutes until golden. Dust with powdered sugar.

recipes.name: Swiss Fondue
instructions: Rub fondue pot with garlic clove.
Heat wine in pot until steaming but not boiling.
Toss cheeses with cornstarch.
Add cheese gradually to wine, stirring constantly until melted.
Stir in kirsch, nutmeg, and pepper.
Keep fondue warm over low flame.
Serve with bread cubes, apples, and pears for dipping.
If someone loses their bread in the pot, they must perform a forfeit!

recipes.name: British Fish and Chips
instructions: Cut potatoes into chips. Soak in water, then dry thoroughly.
Make batter: mix flour, baking powder, and beer until smooth.
Heat oil to 300°F (150°C). Fry chips until soft but not colored. Drain.
Increase oil to 375°F (190°C).
Dip fish in batter and fry until golden and crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Return chips to oil and fry until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels. Season with salt.
Serve with mushy peas, lemon wedges, and malt vinegar.

recipes.name: Polish Bigos (Hunter's Stew)
instructions: Rinse sauerkraut if too sour. Combine with fresh cabbage.
Brown meats in batches. Set aside.
Sauté onion until soft. Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute.
Combine all ingredients in large pot: meats, cabbage, mushrooms, prunes, spices, wine.
Add enough water to barely cover.
Simmer covered for 2-3 hours, stirring occasionally.
The flavor improves over days. Reheat before serving.
Serve with rye bread or boiled potatoes.

recipes.name: French Quiche Lorraine
instructions: Pre-bake pie crust at 375°F (190°C) for 15 minutes.
Cook bacon until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Whisk eggs, cream, milk, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Sprinkle bacon and cheese in pie crust.
Pour egg mixture over.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30-35 minutes until set and golden.
Let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve warm or at room temperature with green salad.

recipes.name: Dutch Stamppot
instructions: Cook potatoes in salted water until tender.
In last 5 minutes, add kale to pot with potatoes.
Meanwhile, brown bacon and cook sausage.
Drain potatoes and kale. Mash with butter and milk.
Stir in bacon and season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Slice sausage and serve on top of stamppot.
Serve with apple sauce on the side.
Traditional to make a well in the center for the gravy.

recipes.name: Russian Beef Stroganoff
instructions: Cook egg noodles according to package directions.
Dust beef with flour, salt, and pepper.
Sauté beef in butter until browned. Remove and set aside.
Sauté mushrooms and onions until soft and browned.
Add wine and reduce by half.
Add stock, mustard, and paprika. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Return beef to pan. Stir in sour cream gently. Do not boil.
Serve over egg noodles, garnished with parsley.

recipes.name: Spanish Tortilla Española
instructions: Heat olive oil in pan. Cook potatoes and onions slowly until soft but not brown (20-25 minutes).
Drain potatoes and onions, reserving oil.
Beat eggs with salt in large bowl.
Add warm potato mixture to eggs. Let sit for 10 minutes.
Heat 2 tbsp reserved oil in non-stick pan.
Add egg-potato mixture. Cook on medium-low for 5-7 minutes until set on bottom.
Place plate over pan and flip tortilla. Slide back into pan.
Cook other side for 3-5 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: French Ratatouille
instructions: Salt eggplant and let drain for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes.
Add eggplant and zucchini, cook until slightly softened.
Add tomatoes, herbs, and bay leaf.
Simmer covered for 45-60 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Remove bay leaf. Adjust seasoning.
Serve warm, cold, or at room temperature with crusty bread.

recipes.name: German Bratwurst with Sauerkraut
instructions: Prick sausages and brown in pan until cooked through.
In separate pan, sauté onion until soft.
Add sauerkraut, apple, caraway seeds, and white wine.
Simmer for 20 minutes until flavors meld.
Meanwhile, boil and mash potatoes with butter.
Serve sausages over sauerkraut with mashed potatoes and mustard.
Traditional with a cold German beer.

recipes.name: Greek Spanakopita
instructions: Sauté onion until soft. Let cool.
Squeeze excess water from spinach.
Mix spinach, cheeses, dill, eggs, nutmeg, and cooled onion.
Brush baking dish with butter. Layer phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter.
Spread filling over phyllo.
Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter.
Score top into squares. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes until golden.
Let cool 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Swedish Gravad Lax
instructions: Mix salt, sugar, and crushed peppercorns.
Place salmon skin-side down. Cover with dill and salt mixture.
Place another salmon fillet on top, flesh-side to flesh-side.
Wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Place in dish with weight on top.
Refrigerate for 2-3 days, turning every 12 hours.
Scrape off cure and slice thinly against the grain.
Serve with mustard-dill sauce and rye bread.
Traditional for Christmas and Midsummer celebrations.

recipes.name: Portuguese Caldo Verde
ingredients: Kale or collard greens, finely shredded
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add potatoes and stock. Simmer until potatoes are tender.
Mash potatoes in the pot to thicken the soup.
Slice sausage and add to soup. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add shredded kale and cook for 5 more minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and crusty bread.
Traditional Portuguese comfort food.

recipes.name: Belgian Waterzooi
instructions: Brown chicken pieces in butter. Remove and set aside.
Sauté vegetables until softened.
Return chicken to pot. Add wine, stock, and herbs.
Simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is cooked.
Remove chicken and vegetables. Keep warm.
Whisk egg yolks and cream. Temper with hot broth.
Return creamy mixture to pot. Do not boil.
Serve chicken and vegetables in bowls with broth poured over.

recipes.name: Austrian Tafelspitz
instructions: Place beef and bones in large pot. Cover with cold water.
Bring to boil, skim foam. Add salt.
Add vegetables and spices. Simmer for 2.5-3 hours.
Remove beef and slice against the grain.
Strain broth and serve as first course.
Make apple-horseradish sauce: mix grated apple and horseradish.
Serve beef with broth, apple-horseradish sauce, and chives.
Traditional Viennese Sunday dinner.

recipes.name: Swiss Rösti
instructions: Peel and grate cooled boiled potatoes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Heat butter in non-stick pan.
Press potatoes into pan to form a cake.
Cook on medium heat for 15 minutes until golden brown.
Flip using a plate and cook other side for 10 minutes.
For bacon rösti: cook bacon first, then cook potatoes in bacon fat.
Serve as breakfast or side dish with eggs or sausage.

recipes.name: British Shepherd's Pie
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes with butter and milk.
Brown lamb with onion and carrots.
Add tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, and thyme.
Add stock and simmer until thickened.
Stir in peas.
Transfer meat to baking dish. Top with mashed potatoes.
Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25 minutes until golden.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Polish Pierogi
instructions: Make dough: mix flour, eggs, sour cream, and salt. Knead until smooth.
For filling: mix mashed potatoes, cheese, and sautéed onion.
Roll dough thin. Cut circles with cutter.
Place filling on each circle. Fold and seal edges.
Boil in salted water until they float, then 2-3 minutes more.
Sauté boiled pierogi in butter until lightly browned.
Serve with sour cream and extra sautéed onions.
Traditional for Christmas and family gatherings.

recipes.name: French Croque Monsieur
instructions: Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Whisk in milk until thick. Add nutmeg.
Spread mustard on bread slices.
Make sandwiches with ham and some cheese.
Spread béchamel on top of sandwiches. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly.
For Croque Madame: add fried egg on top.
Serve with cornichons and green salad.
Classic French café lunch.

recipes.name: Dutch Bitterballen
ingredients: Cooked beef or veal, finely chopped
instructions: Make ragout: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Whisk in stock until very thick.
Add meat, parsley, nutmeg. Season well.
Spread on tray. Chill completely until firm.
Form into small balls.
Dip in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Chill again for 30 minutes.
Deep-fry at 375°F (190°C) until golden brown.
Serve hot with mustard for dipping.

recipes.name: Russian Olivier Salad
instructions: Boil potatoes, carrots, and eggs until tender. Cool completely.
Dice all vegetables, eggs, and meat uniformly.
Mix with peas and pickles.
Combine mayonnaise and sour cream for dressing.
Gently fold dressing into salad.
Season with salt, pepper, and dill.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
Traditional for New Year celebrations.

recipes.name: Spanish Gazpacho
instructions: Soak bread in water briefly, then squeeze dry.
Roughly chop tomatoes, cucumber, and bell pepper.
Blend vegetables with garlic, bread, olive oil, and vinegar.
Strain through sieve for smoother texture (optional).
Season with salt. Chill for at least 2 hours.
Serve cold with garnishes.
Perfect hot-weather dish.
Traditional Andalusian cold soup.

recipes.name: Hungarian Chicken Paprikash
instructions: Brown chicken pieces in butter. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion until soft. Remove from heat.
Add paprika and tomato paste, stir quickly.
Return chicken to pot. Add stock.
Simmer for 45 minutes until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken. Make slurry with flour and sour cream.
Stir slurry into sauce. Return chicken to heat through.
Serve over egg noodles.

recipes.name: German Black Forest Cake
instructions: Make chocolate cake layers. Cool completely.
Soak cherries in kirsch for 30 minutes.
Whip cream with sugar and vanilla until stiff peaks.
Place first cake layer on plate. Brush with kirsch.
Spread with whipped cream and cherries.
Repeat with remaining layers.
Frost entire cake with whipped cream.
Decorate with chocolate shavings and whole cherries.

recipes.name: French Duck Confit
instructions: Salt duck legs heavily with herbs and spices. Refrigerate for 24-48 hours.
Rinse off salt and pat dry.
Melt duck fat in ovenproof dish.
Submerge duck legs in fat completely.
Cook at 300°F (150°C) for 2.5-3 hours until very tender.
Cool in fat. Store submerged in fat for up to 2 weeks.
To serve: remove from fat, crisp skin-side down in pan.
Serve with potatoes fried in duck fat.

recipes.name: Austrian Sachertorte
instructions: Melt chocolate and butter together. Cool slightly.
Beat egg yolks with sugar until pale.
Fold chocolate into yolk mixture.
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks. Fold into batter.
Fold in flour gently.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45-50 minutes. Cool completely.
Split cake. Spread apricot jam between layers and on top.
Pour chocolate glaze over cake. Serve with whipped cream.

recipes.name: Portuguese Pastéis de Nata
instructions: Roll puff pastry thin. Roll up tightly and slice into rounds.
Press rounds into muffin tins to form cups.
Heat milk with cinnamon and lemon zest. Strain.
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and egg yolks. Temper with hot milk.
Cook custard until thick.
Fill pastry cups with custard.
Bake at 500°F (260°C) for 15-20 minutes until blistered.
Dust with cinnamon and sugar. Serve warm.

recipes.name: French Cassoulet
instructions: Soak beans overnight. Simmer until tender.
Brown all meats in batches. Set aside.
Sauté vegetables until soft. Add tomato paste.
Layer beans, meats, and vegetables in cassoulet pot.
Add herbs and enough stock to cover.
Top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 3-4 hours.
Break crust and push down several times during cooking.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

recipes.name: German Potato Pancakes (Kartoffelpuffer)
instructions: Grate potatoes and onion. Squeeze out excess liquid.
Mix with eggs, flour, salt, and nutmeg.
Heat oil in pan. Drop spoonfuls of batter.
Flatten and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve hot with applesauce or sour cream.
Traditional German street food.
Best eaten immediately.

recipes.name: Greek Souvlaki
instructions: Marinate pork in lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, and oregano for 1+ hours.
Thread onto skewers.
Grill over high heat, turning occasionally.
Warm pita bread on grill.
Serve pork in pita with tomato, onion, and tzatziki.
Can also be served on plate with rice and salad.
Classic Greek street food.
Serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Swedish Janssons Frestelse
instructions: Butter baking dish. Layer potatoes and onions.
Place anchovy fillets between layers.
Pour cream over everything.
Top with breadcrumbs and dot with butter.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 45-60 minutes until golden.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.
Traditional Swedish Christmas dish.
The anchovies melt into a savory flavor.

recipes.name: Portuguese Frango Piri Piri
instructions: Make marinade: blend chilies, garlic, lemon juice, oil, and spices.
Marinate chicken for 2+ hours.
Grill over medium heat, skin-side down first.
Baste with marinade while cooking.
Cook until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Serve with fries and salad.
Famous Portuguese grilled chicken.

recipes.name: Belgian Carbonade Flamande
instructions: Brown beef and bacon. Set aside.
Caramelize onions with brown sugar.
Return meat to pot. Add beer, herbs, and vinegar.
Simmer covered for 2 hours.
Place mustard-spread bread on top of stew.
Cook 30 more minutes until thickened.
Remove bread before serving.
Serve with fries or mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Austrian Kaiserschmarrn
instructions: Soak raisins in rum or warm water.
Mix flour, milk, eggs, sugar, and salt for batter.
Stir in drained raisins.
Melt butter in large pan. Pour in batter.
Cook until set, then flip or tear into pieces.
Continue cooking until golden and torn into ragged pieces.
Dust with powdered sugar.
Serve with apple sauce or plum compote.

recipes.name: Swiss Zürcher Geschnetzeltes
instructions: Sauté veal quickly in butter. Remove and set aside.
Sauté mushrooms and shallots until soft.
Deglaze with white wine. Reduce by half.
Add cream and simmer until slightly thickened.
Return veal to pan. Heat through.
Stir in lemon juice and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with rösti or spätzle.

recipes.name: British Beef Wellington
instructions: Sear beef on all sides. Brush with mustard. Cool completely.
Sauté mushrooms until dry. Cool.
Roll out pastry. Layer prosciutto, then mushroom duxelles.
Place beef on top. Wrap tightly in pastry.
Brush with egg wash. Score pattern on top.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25-35 minutes for medium-rare.
Rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve with red wine sauce.

recipes.name: Polish Żurek
instructions: Make żur base: ferment rye flour and water for 3-5 days.
Cook bacon and kielbasa. Remove and slice.
Add potatoes to broth. Cook until tender.
Stir in żur base slowly.
Add meats, garlic, and spices. Simmer 20 minutes.
Serve with hard-boiled egg and horseradish.
Traditional Polish Easter soup.
Sour, savory, and comforting.

recipes.name: French Salade Niçoise
instructions: Arrange lettuce on platter.
Compose salad: group ingredients attractively.
Place tuna in center.
Arrange potatoes, beans, tomatoes, eggs around.
Garnish with anchovies and olives.
Drizzle with vinaigrette.
Traditional from Nice, France.
Serve as main course lunch.

recipes.name: Dutch Erwtensoep
instructions: Soak split peas if using whole.
Brown pork. Add to large pot with peas and vegetables.
Cover with water. Add herbs.
Simmer for 2-3 hours until thick.
Add sausage in last 30 minutes.
Remove meat, shred, and return to soup.
Should be thick enough for spoon to stand up.
Serve with rye bread and bacon.

recipes.name: Russian Pelmeni
instructions: Make dough: mix flour, eggs, water, and salt. Rest 30 minutes.
Mix meats with onion, salt, and pepper for filling.
Roll dough thin. Cut circles.
Place filling on circles. Fold and seal into half-moons.
Pinch ends together to form traditional shape.
Boil in salted water until they float, then 2-3 minutes more.
Serve with sour cream, vinegar, and dill.
Can be frozen for later use.

recipes.name: Spanish Churros con Chocolate
instructions: Boil water with butter and salt.
Add flour all at once. Stir vigorously until dough forms.
Pipe dough through star tip into hot oil.
Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Mix sugar and cinnamon. Roll churros in mixture.
Melt chocolate with milk and cornstarch for dipping sauce.
Serve churros warm with thick chocolate sauce.
Spanish breakfast or snack.

recipes.name: Hungarian Langos
instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water with sugar.
Mix flour, mashed potatoes, salt, and yeast mixture.
Knead until smooth. Let rise for 1-2 hours.
Divide into portions. Stretch into rounds.
Fry in hot oil until puffed and golden.
Rub with garlic while hot.
Top with sour cream and cheese.
Hungarian street food classic.

recipes.name: German Rote Grütze
instructions: Cook berries with sugar and water until soft.
Mix cornstarch with water. Stir into berries.
Cook until thickened and clear.
Pour into serving dishes. Cool completely.
Chill until set.
Serve with vanilla sauce or ice cream.
Northern German summer dessert.
Can use fresh or frozen berries.

recipes.name: French Tarte Tatin
instructions: Caramelize sugar and butter in ovenproof pan.
Arrange apples tightly in pan on caramel.
Cook on stovetop until apples release juice.
Cover with pastry round. Tuck edges inside.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes.
Let cool 5 minutes, then invert onto plate.
Serve warm with crème fraîche.
Upside-down apple tart.

recipes.name: Austrian Linzer Torte
instructions: Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time.
Mix in flour, nuts, spices, and lemon zest.
Chill dough for 30 minutes.
Press 2/3 dough into tart pan.
Spread with raspberry jam.
Roll remaining dough into strips. Create lattice pattern.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40-45 minutes.
Dust with powdered sugar when cool.

recipes.name: Portuguese Caldeirada
ingredients: Mixed firm fish (monkfish, cod, sea bass)
instructions: Layer potatoes, onions, peppers, and tomatoes in pot.
Add fish and shellfish in layers.
Add wine, garlic, paprika, and bay leaves.
Cover and simmer until fish is cooked and shells open.
Discard any unopened shellfish.
Garnish with parsley.
Portuguese fisherman's stew.
Serve with crusty bread.

recipes.name: French Bouillabaisse
instructions: Sauté fennel, onion, and garlic until soft.
Add tomatoes, saffron, and herbs. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add wine and reduce by half.
Add fish stock and bring to a boil.
Add firm fish first, then delicate fish and shellfish.
Simmer until fish is cooked and shells open.
Serve broth first with bread and rouille.
Follow with fish and seafood course.

recipes.name: German Spätzle
instructions: Mix flour, eggs, water, salt, and nutmeg to form thick batter.
Rest batter for 15 minutes.
Press batter through spätzle maker or colander into boiling water.
Cook until they float, then 1-2 minutes more.
Remove with slotted spoon. Shock in ice water.
Sauté in butter until lightly browned.
Garnish with parsley.
Serve as side dish or with cheese (Käsespätzle).

recipes.name: Greek Gyros
instructions: Marinate meat in oil, lemon juice, garlic, and herbs for 2+ hours.
Stack meat slices on vertical rotisserie or form into loaf.
Cook slowly, rotating until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Slice thin strips from outside as it cooks.
Warm pita bread.
Serve meat in pita with tomatoes, onions, tzatziki, and fries.
Traditional Greek street food.
Can also bake as a meat loaf and slice.

recipes.name: Swedish Köttbullar
instructions: Soak breadcrumbs in milk.
Mix meats, onion, egg, spices, and breadcrumb mixture.
Form into small meatballs.
Brown in butter until cooked through.
Make cream sauce in same pan.
Return meatballs to sauce.
Serve with mashed potatoes, lingonberry jam, and pickled cucumber.
Swedish classic made famous worldwide.

recipes.name: Portuguese Arroz de Pato
instructions: Brown duck pieces. Remove and set aside.
Sauté bacon, chouriço, onion, and garlic.
Add tomato and cook until softened.
Add rice and stir to coat.
Add wine, stock, bay leaves, and orange zest.
Return duck to pot. Simmer until rice is almost cooked.
Transfer to baking dish. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 minutes.
Garnish with parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Belgian Endive au Gratin
instructions: Trim endives. Cook in boiling water with lemon juice for 10 minutes.
Drain and cool. Squeeze out excess water.
Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Whisk in milk until thick. Add nutmeg.
Wrap each endive in ham slice (if using).
Place in baking dish. Cover with béchamel.
Sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes until golden.
Serve as side dish or light main course.

recipes.name: Austrian Goulash Soup
instructions: Brown beef in oil. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion until soft. Remove from heat.
Add paprika and caraway seeds, stir quickly.
Return beef to pot. Add flour and cook 1 minute.
Add stock, tomato paste, and marjoram.
Simmer for 1 hour until beef is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook 20 more minutes.
Serve with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Swiss Bircher Müesli
instructions: Mix oats with milk or yogurt.
Stir in grated apple and lemon juice.
Add honey and cinnamon to taste.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or overnight.
Stir before serving.
Top with nuts and fresh berries.
Original Swiss breakfast created by Dr. Bircher-Benner.
Healthy start to the day.

recipes.name: British Sticky Toffee Pudding
instructions: Soak dates in boiling water with baking soda.
Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Fold in flour and date mixture.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30-35 minutes.
Make toffee sauce: melt butter, sugar, and cream.
Pour some sauce over warm pudding.
Serve with remaining sauce and vanilla ice cream.
British pub dessert classic.

recipes.name: Polish Gołąbki
instructions: Blanch cabbage to soften leaves. Remove tough stems.
Mix meats, rice, onion, and seasonings for filling.
Place filling on cabbage leaves. Roll tightly.
Place in baking dish. Cover with tomato sauce and mushrooms.
Add bay leaves and thyme.
Bake covered at 350°F (175°C) for 1.5 hours.
Serve with sour cream.
Polish 'little pigeons' - stuffed cabbage rolls.

recipes.name: French Soufflé au Fromage
instructions: Butter and coat soufflé dishes with grated cheese.
Make béchamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Whisk in milk until thick.
Remove from heat. Stir in egg yolks, cheeses, and nutmeg.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff peaks.
Fold whites into cheese mixture gently.
Fill dishes to top. Smooth surfaces.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes until puffed and golden.
Serve immediately - they wait for no one!

recipes.name: Dutch Poffertjes
instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm milk.
Mix flours, egg, and yeast mixture to form batter.
Let rise for 1 hour until bubbly.
Heat poffertjes pan or heavy skillet.
Butter wells. Pour batter into wells.
Flip when bubbles form and edges set.
Cook until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with butter and powdered sugar.

recipes.name: Russian Shashlik
instructions: Marinate meat with onions, vinegar, lemon juice, and spices for 24+ hours.
Thread meat on skewers with peppers and tomatoes.
Grill over charcoal, turning frequently.
Baste with marinade while cooking.
Cook until nicely charred but still juicy.
Serve with flatbread and sour cream sauce.
Russian shish kebab.
Perfect for outdoor cooking.

recipes.name: Spanish Fabada Asturiana
instructions: Soak beans overnight.
Place all ingredients in large pot.
Cover with cold water. Bring to simmer.
Cook very slowly for 2-3 hours until beans are tender.
Do not boil vigorously - beans should remain whole.
Remove meats and slice before serving.
Serve beans in broth with sliced meats.
Asturian bean stew - Spanish comfort food.

recipes.name: Hungarian Dobos Torte
instructions: Make sponge layers: beat eggs and sugar until thick. Fold in flour.
Spread thin circles on parchment. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 5-7 minutes.
Make chocolate buttercream: cream butter, add melted chocolate and coffee.
Stack layers with buttercream between each.
Make caramel: cook sugar until amber. Pour over final layer.
Score caramel into slices before it hardens.
Coat sides with chopped hazelnuts.
Hungarian layered cake invention.

recipes.name: German Königsberger Klopse
instructions: Mix meats, breadcrumbs, egg, onion, and anchovies.
Form into meatballs.
Poach in simmering stock for 15 minutes. Remove meatballs.
Make sauce: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Whisk in poaching liquid.
Stir in sour cream, capers, and lemon juice.
Return meatballs to sauce. Heat through.
Serve with boiled potatoes or rice.
East Prussian meatballs in caper sauce.

recipes.name: French Blanquette de Veau
instructions: Blanch veal in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain.
Cover with fresh water. Add vegetables and herbs.
Simmer for 1.5 hours until veal is tender.
Strain broth. Make roux with butter and flour.
Whisk in broth to make sauce.
Temper egg yolks with cream. Add to sauce off heat.
Return veal and vegetables to sauce. Add lemon juice.
Serve with rice or boiled potatoes.

recipes.name: Austrian Marillenknödel
instructions: Mix mashed potatoes, flour, and egg to form dough.
Wrap each apricot around a sugar cube in dough ball.
Form smooth dumplings.
Boil in salted water until they float, then 5 minutes more.
Sauté breadcrumbs in butter until golden.
Roll dumplings in buttery breadcrumbs.
Dust with powdered sugar and cinnamon.
Austrian apricot dumplings from Wachau valley.

recipes.name: Portuguese Bifana
instructions: Marinate pork in wine, garlic, paprika, and bay leaves for 2+ hours.
Grill or pan-fry quickly until cooked through.
Pile onto crusty rolls.
Serve with mustard and hot sauce.
Optional: top with sautéed onions and peppers.
Portuguese pork sandwich.
Popular at festivals and markets.
Simple but incredibly flavorful.

recipes.name: French Pot-au-Feu
instructions: Place meats in large pot. Cover with cold water.
Bring to simmer, skim foam. Add salt and spices.
Simmer for 2 hours.
Add vegetables and continue simmering for 1 more hour.
Remove meats and vegetables. Strain broth.
Serve broth first as soup course.
Follow with sliced meats and vegetables.
Serve with coarse salt, cornichons, and mustard.

recipes.name: German Himmel und Erde
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender.
Peel and slice apples. Cook until soft.
Mash potatoes and apples together with butter.
Sauté blood sausage with onions.
Serve mashed potato-apple mixture topped with sausage and onions.
Accompany with apple sauce.
'Heaven and Earth' - potatoes from earth, apples from heaven.
Rhineland classic dish.

recipes.name: Greek Youvetsi
instructions: Brown meat in olive oil. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Return meat to pot. Add wine, tomato sauce, and spices.
Simmer for 1.5 hours until meat is tender.
Stir in orzo and enough water to cook pasta.
Transfer to baking dish. Top with cheese.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 minutes until golden.
Greek baked pasta with meat.

recipes.name: Swedish Pytt i Panna
instructions: Sauté onion in butter until soft.
Add potatoes and meat. Cook until crispy and heated through.
Season with salt and pepper.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Serve hash topped with fried egg.
Accompany with pickled beets.
Swedish 'small pieces in pan' - perfect for leftovers.
Traditional Swedish hash.

recipes.name: Portuguese Arroz de Marisco
instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and pepper until soft.
Add tomato and cook until broken down.
Add rice and stir to coat.
Pour in wine and stock. Bring to simmer.
Add seafood in order of cooking time.
Cover and cook until rice is done and shells open.
Discard any unopened shellfish.
Garnish with parsley and serve with piri piri.

recipes.name: Belgian Carbonnade Flamande
instructions: Brown beef and bacon. Set aside.
Caramelize onions with brown sugar.
Return meat to pot. Add beer, herbs, and vinegar.
Simmer covered for 2 hours.
Place mustard-spread bread on top of stew.
Cook 30 more minutes until thickened.
Remove bread before serving.
Serve with fries or mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Austrian Topfenknödel
instructions: Mix quark, flour, semolina, eggs, and sugar to form dough.
Let rest for 30 minutes.
Form into dumplings.
Boil in salted water until they float, then 5 minutes more.
Sauté breadcrumbs in butter until golden.
Roll dumplings in buttery breadcrumbs.
Serve with plum compote or stewed fruit.
Austrian cheese dumplings - light and fluffy.

recipes.name: Swiss Älplermagronen
instructions: Cook macaroni and potatoes together until tender.
Sauté bacon until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Sauté onions in bacon fat until caramelized.
Layer pasta, potatoes, bacon, onions, and cheese in baking dish.
Pour cream over top. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 minutes until bubbly.
Serve with apple sauce on the side.
Alpine herdsman's macaroni - Swiss comfort food.

recipes.name: British Bubble and Squeak
ingredients: Leftover cooked cabbage or Brussels sprouts
instructions: Mix potatoes and vegetables together.
Heat butter in skillet.
Press mixture into pan. Cook until golden brown on bottom.
Flip and cook other side until crispy.
Serve with fried eggs and bacon if desired.
Perfect for using Sunday roast leftovers.
Named for the sound it makes while cooking.
Traditional British breakfast or supper.

recipes.name: Polish Barszcz Czerwony
instructions: Combine beets, onion, garlic, and spices in pot.
Add stock and simmer for 1 hour.
Strain through cheesecloth for clear broth.
Season with sugar, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Serve clear or with grated beets added back.
Traditional for Christmas Eve.
Serve with mushroom dumplings (uszka).
Beautiful ruby-red color.

recipes.name: French Tarte Flambée
instructions: Roll dough very thin into rectangle.
Mix crème fraîche and fromage blanc. Spread on dough.
Sprinkle with bacon and onions.
Season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Bake at highest oven temperature (500°F/260°C) for 8-10 minutes.
Should be crispy and slightly charred.
Alsatian 'flamed tart' - though not actually flamed.
Serve cut into squares.

recipes.name: Dutch Hutspot
instructions: Cook meat with bay leaves until tender.
Boil potatoes, carrots, and onions together until soft.
Drain vegetables. Remove bay leaves.
Mash with butter and milk.
Shred meat and mix into vegetables or serve separately.
Season with salt and pepper.
Dutch carrot and potato mash.
Traditional winter comfort food.

recipes.name: Russian Kholodets
instructions: Cover meats with cold water. Bring to boil, skim foam.
Add vegetables and spices. Simmer for 5-6 hours.
Strain broth. Shred meat, discarding bones.
Arrange meat and sliced eggs in molds.
Pour strained broth over.
Refrigerate for 24 hours until firmly set.
Serve cold, sliced, with horseradish.
Russian jellied meat - acquired taste!

recipes.name: Spanish Cocido Madrileño
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight.
Layer meats and chickpeas in pot. Cover with water.
Simmer for 2 hours.
Add vegetables and cook 1 more hour.
Strain broth for soup course with noodles.
Serve chickpeas and vegetables as second course.
Serve meats as third course.
Madrid's famous multi-course stew.

recipes.name: Hungarian Halászlé
instructions: Sauté onion until soft. Remove from heat.
Add paprika and stir quickly.
Add tomato, pepper, and stock.
Bring to boil. Add fish in order of cooking time.
Simmer until fish is cooked.
Season with salt and hot paprika.
Should be fiery and flavorful.
Fisherman's soup - traditionally cooked over open fire.

recipes.name: German Dampfnudeln
instructions: Make yeast dough with flour, milk, eggs, and sugar.
Let rise for 1 hour.
Form into small balls.
Cook in covered pan with milk and butter.
Steam until bottoms are golden and tops are fluffy.
Serve with vanilla sauce and fruit compote.
Can be sweet or savory.
German steamed yeast dumplings.

recipes.name: French Canard à l'Orange
instructions: Score duck skin. Season with salt and pepper.
Roast until skin is crispy and internal temperature reaches 135°F (57°C).
Make caramel with sugar and vinegar.
Add orange juice and zest. Reduce.
Add stock and reduce to sauce consistency.
Finish with butter and orange liqueur.
Slice duck and serve with orange sauce.
Classic French duck with orange.

recipes.name: Austrian Salzburger Nockerl
instructions: Butter baking dish. Add milk to bottom.
Beat egg whites with sugar until stiff peaks.
Beat yolks with vanilla sugar until pale.
Fold yolks and flour into whites gently.
Form three large mounds in baking dish.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden.
Dust with powdered sugar.
Serve immediately with raspberry sauce.

recipes.name: Portuguese Caldo Verde
ingredients: Kale or collard greens, finely shredded
instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add potatoes and stock. Simmer until potatoes are tender.
Mash potatoes in the pot to thicken the soup.
Slice sausage and add to soup. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add shredded kale and cook for 5 more minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and crusty bread.
Traditional Portuguese comfort food.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked. Set aside.
In a pan, heat butter and add tomato puree. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add cream, sugar, and all powdered spices. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the cooked chicken pieces and kasuri methi. Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with more cream and butter. Serve with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch spinach in hot water for 2 minutes. Blend into a puree.
Heat oil, sauté cumin seeds, then add onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add spinach puree and cook for 10 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

recipes.name: Chole Bhature
instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas with tea bags until soft. Discard tea bags.
For chole: Heat oil, sauté onions, then add tomato puree and spices.
Add cooked chickpeas and water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
For bhature: Mix flour, yogurt, baking powder, and salt. Knead a soft dough. Rest for 2 hours.
Roll dough into circles and deep-fry until puffed and golden.
Serve chole hot with bhature, sliced onions, and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal with fenugreek seeds for 6 hours.
Grind into a smooth batter. Ferment overnight.
For potato filling: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, red chilies, and curry leaves.
Add onions, sauté until translucent. Add turmeric and mashed potatoes.
Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour dosa batter on a hot griddle, spread thinly.
Cook until crisp, place potato filling in center, and fold.
Serve with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Rogan Josh
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoking. Cool slightly.
Sauté whole spices until fragrant.
Add onions and cook until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and lamb pieces. Brown the meat.
Add all spice powders and yogurt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add water, cover, and simmer on low heat for 1-1.5 hours until meat is tender.
Garnish with ginger juliennes. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Dal Makhani
ingredients: 1 cup Whole Black Gram (Sabut Urad Dal)
instructions: Soak urad dal and rajma overnight. Pressure cook until very soft.
Heat butter, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and spices. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked dal and water. Simmer on low heat for 1-2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Add cream and butter. Simmer for another 15 minutes.
Garnish with more cream. Serve with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil all vegetables until soft. Mash coarsely.
Heat butter, sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste, capsicum, and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add pav bhaji masala and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add mashed vegetables and water. Simmer for 10 minutes.
For pav: Slice and toast with butter on a griddle.
Garnish bhaji with butter, coriander, and lemon. Serve with pav.

recipes.name: Biryani (Chicken)
ingredients: Whole Spices (Bay leaf, Cardamom, Cinnamon, Cloves)
instructions: Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Parboil with whole spices. Drain.
Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours.
Caramelize onions until golden brown.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer marinated chicken, rice, fried onions, mint, and coriander.
Repeat layers. Top with saffron-infused milk and ghee.
Seal the pot with dough. Cook on low heat (dum) for 25-30 minutes.
Let it rest for 15 minutes. Fluff gently and serve with raita.

recipes.name: Idli
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal with fenugreek seeds separately for 6 hours.
Grind urad dal to a fluffy, smooth batter.
Grind rice to a slightly coarse batter.
Mix both batters with salt. Ferment overnight.
Grease idli molds. Pour batter into molds.
Steam for 10-12 minutes until cooked.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add all dry spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add potatoes and cauliflower. Mix well to coat with spices.
Cover and cook on low heat until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Make deep cuts on the chicken pieces.
Mix yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and spices.
Coat chicken well with the marinade. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours (overnight is best).
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place chicken on a rack and bake for 25-30 minutes, turning once.
Brush with oil/butter and grill for 2-3 minutes for a charred effect.
Serve with onion rings, lemon wedges, and mint chutney.

recipes.name: Rajma Masala
instructions: Pressure cook rajma until very soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add all spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add cooked rajma and some water. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Mash some rajma with the back of a spoon to thicken the gravy.
Garnish with coriander. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Pani Puri
instructions: For pani: Blend mint, coriander, green chilies, and spices with water. Strain.
Add black salt, chaat masala, and jaggery. Adjust taste. Chill.
For filling: Mix mashed potatoes and chickpeas with a little salt and chaat masala.
Make a hole in each puri. Fill with potato-chickpea mixture.
Add a little tamarind chutney.
Dip in the chilled mint water and eat immediately.

recipes.name: Malai Kofta
ingredients: For Koftas: Paneer, Potatoes, Cornflour, Cashews, Raisins
For Gravy: Onions, Tomatoes, Cashew Paste, Cream, Butter
instructions: For koftas: Grate and mix paneer, boiled potatoes, and cornflour. Shape into balls with a cashew and raisin inside. Deep-fry until golden. Set aside.
For gravy: Sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Blend into a smooth paste. Return to pan, add cashew paste and spices.
Add cream and butter. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add koftas just before serving. Garnish with more cream.
Serve with naan or jeera rice.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas with tea leaves until soft. Drain.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until mushy.
Add all spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas and water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Mash some chickpeas to thicken the gravy.
Finish with amchur powder and a sprinkle of garam masala.
Garnish with onions and coriander. Serve with bhatura or rice.

recipes.name: Rava Dosa
instructions: Mix rava, rice flour, maida, and salt in a bowl.
Add water gradually to make a thin, flowing batter.
Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, coriander, pepper, and cumin seeds. Rest for 15-20 minutes.
Heat a non-stick tawa. Pour the batter from the outside in a circular motion to form a thin, lacy dosa.
Drizzle oil around the edges. Cook on medium-high heat until crisp and golden.
Flip and cook for a minute. No need to cook the other side if you like it crisp.
Serve immediately with sambar and chutney.

recipes.name: Fish Curry (Goan)
instructions: Soak red chilies, coriander seeds, cumin, and tamarind in hot water for 15 minutes.
Grind into a smooth paste with garlic and turmeric.
Heat coconut oil, sauté onions until soft.
Add the ground paste and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add coconut milk and water. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add fish pieces and salt. Cook for 8-10 minutes on low heat until fish is cooked.
Do not boil vigorously after adding fish.
Garnish with coriander. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Matar Paneer
ingredients: 1 cup Green Peas (Matar), fresh or frozen
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add all dry spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add green peas and a little water. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with garam masala and coriander leaves.
Serve hot with roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Vada Pav
instructions: For vada: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, and turmeric. Sauté for a minute.
Add mashed potatoes and salt. Mix well. Cool and shape into balls.
Make a batter with besan, salt, and water (coatting consistency).
Dip potato balls in batter and deep-fry until golden brown.
Slice pav, spread chutneys, place vada inside.
Serve with fried green chilies and more chutney.

recipes.name: Pongal
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until fragrant. Wash with rice.
Pressure cook rice and dal with 4 cups water for 4-5 whistles.
Mash the cooked mixture slightly.
Heat ghee, temper with peppercorns, cumin, curry leaves, and ginger.
Add cashews and roast until golden.
Pour the tempering over the pongal. Mix well.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Baingan Bharta
instructions: Roast the whole brinjal directly over flame until skin is charred and flesh is soft.
Let it cool, then peel off the skin and mash the pulp.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Add mashed brinjal. Cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with roti.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka
instructions: Prick chicken pieces with a fork.
Mix yogurt, tikka masala, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and spices.
Add chicken and mix well. Marinate for at least 4 hours.
Add gram flour to the marinade and mix (helps in coating).
Skewer the chicken pieces.
Grill in oven or on tawa until cooked and slightly charred.
Brush with oil/butter while grilling.
Serve with onion rings and mint chutney.

recipes.name: Mysore Masala Dosa
instructions: For Mysore chutney: Soak red chilies, chana dal, urad dal in hot water for 30 minutes.
Grind with coconut, tamarind, and salt to a smooth paste.
Heat oil and temper the chutney with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Make a regular dosa on hot tawa.
Spread a layer of Mysore chutney on the dosa.
Place potato masala in the center and fold.
Serve immediately with more chutney and sambar.

recipes.name: Kadhai Paneer
instructions: Heat butter, add crushed coriander seeds.
Add onions and capsicum. Sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add kadhai masala and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and kasuri methi. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add a splash of cream if desired.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with naan or roti.

recipes.name: Kerala Fish Molee
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Shallow fry fish lightly. Set aside.
Heat coconut oil, sauté onions until soft.
Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Add turmeric and pepper. Cook for a minute.
Add coconut milk and salt. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add fried fish pieces. Cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat.
Drizzle with coconut oil. Serve with appam or rice.

recipes.name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Knead wheat flour with water into a soft dough. Rest for 20 minutes.
Mix mashed potatoes, onions, green chilies, and spices for filling.
Divide dough and filling into equal portions.
Roll a dough ball, place filling, seal and roll into a paratha.
Cook on hot tawa, applying ghee on both sides until golden.
Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or butter.

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Bagara Baingan
instructions: Make 2 slits in each brinjal keeping the stem intact.
Dry roast peanuts, sesame seeds, and coconut. Grind to a paste.
Heat oil, fry brinjals lightly until slightly soft. Remove.
In same oil, add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add ground paste and tamarind. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add water and bring to a simmer.
Add fried brinjals. Cook covered on low heat for 15 minutes.
Serve with biryani or steamed rice.

recipes.name: Litti Chokha
instructions: Knead wheat flour with water and ajwain into stiff dough.
Mix sattu with mustard oil, spices, and lemon juice for filling.
Stuff dough balls with sattu mixture and shape into littis.
Bake in oven or traditional coal fire until cooked and crisp.
For chokha: Roast brinjal, tomatoes, and potatoes. Peel and mash.
Mix with chopped onions, garlic, green chilies, mustard oil, and coriander.
Dip hot littis in ghee and serve with chokha.

recipes.name: Kolkata Chicken Roll
instructions: Marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste and sauces for 30 minutes.
Stir-fry chicken until cooked. Set aside.
Beat egg with salt. Spread on hot tawa, place paratha on top.
Cook until egg sets and paratha is heated.
Place chicken filling, onions, capsicum on paratha.
Squeeze lemon juice and roll tightly.
Wrap in paper and serve hot.

recipes.name: Methi Thepla
instructions: Mix flour, methi leaves, spices, yogurt, and oil.
Knead into a soft dough using water. Rest for 15 minutes.
Divide into small balls and roll into thin theplas.
Cook on hot tawa with little oil until golden spots appear.
Serve with yogurt, pickle, or chunda.

recipes.name: Chettinad Chicken
instructions: Heat coconut oil, add fennel seeds and curry leaves.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add Chettinad masala and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add chicken pieces and mix well.
Add water, cover and cook until chicken is tender.
Finish with a tempering of mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Serve hot with appam, dosa, or rice.

recipes.name: Pesarattu
ingredients: 2 cups Whole Green Gram (Moong Dal), soaked
instructions: Grind soaked moong dal with green chilies, ginger, and cumin to a coarse batter.
Add rice flour and salt. Mix well.
Heat tawa, pour batter and spread like dosa.
Drizzle oil and cook until crisp both sides.
Serve with ginger chutney or allam pachadi.

recipes.name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and prick with fork.
Deep fry until golden. Set aside.
Whisk yogurt with fennel powder, ginger powder, and chilli powder.
Heat ghee, add asafoetida, then yogurt mixture.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously until oil separates.
Add water, salt, and fried potatoes.
Simmer on low heat (dum) for 15-20 minutes.
Garnish with coriander. Serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Bombay Sandwich
instructions: Butter all bread slices on one side.
Spread green chutney on two slices.
Layer with potato slices, cucumber, tomato, and onion.
Sprinkle chaat masala and salt.
Cover with other bread slices, butter side up.
Grill in sandwich maker until golden and crisp.
Cut into triangles and serve with ketchup.

recipes.name: Laal Maas
instructions: Soak red chilies in hot water for 20 minutes. Grind to paste.
Heat ghee, sauté onions until dark brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and mutton. Brown the meat.
Add chilli paste and spices. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add yogurt and cook until oil separates.
Add water, cover and simmer until meat is tender (1-1.5 hours).
Serve hot with bajra roti or rice.

recipes.name: Medu Vada
instructions: Soak urad dal for 4-6 hours. Drain completely.
Grind to a smooth, fluffy batter with minimal water.
Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, pepper, and salt.
Add rice flour and mix well.
Wet hands, shape batter into doughnut shapes with hole in center.
Deep fry in medium-hot oil until golden and crisp.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Gajar Ka Halwa
instructions: Cook grated carrots in milk on medium heat, stirring frequently.
Cook until milk is completely absorbed and carrots are soft.
Add ghee and cook for 10 minutes, stirring continuously.
Add sugar and cook until moisture evaporates.
In separate pan, fry cashews and raisins in ghee until golden.
Add to halwa along with cardamom powder.
Serve hot or cold, garnished with more nuts.

recipes.name: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil all vegetables until soft. Mash coarsely.
Heat butter, sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste, capsicum, and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add pav bhaji masala and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add mashed vegetables and water. Simmer for 10 minutes.
For pav: Slice and toast with butter on a griddle.
Garnish bhaji with butter, coriander, and lemon. Serve with pav.

recipes.name: Biryani (Chicken)
ingredients: Whole Spices (Bay leaf, Cardamom, Cinnamon, Cloves)
instructions: Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Parboil with whole spices. Drain.
Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours.
Caramelize onions until golden brown.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer marinated chicken, rice, fried onions, mint, and coriander.
Repeat layers. Top with saffron-infused milk and ghee.
Seal the pot with dough. Cook on low heat (dum) for 25-30 minutes.
Let it rest for 15 minutes. Fluff gently and serve with raita.

recipes.name: Idli
instructions: Soak rice and urad dal with fenugreek seeds separately for 6 hours.
Grind urad dal to a fluffy, smooth batter.
Grind rice to a slightly coarse batter.
Mix both batters with salt. Ferment overnight.
Grease idli molds. Pour batter into molds.
Steam for 10-12 minutes until cooked.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add all dry spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add potatoes and cauliflower. Mix well to coat with spices.
Cover and cook on low heat until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve with roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Make deep cuts on the chicken pieces.
Mix yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and spices.
Coat chicken well with the marinade. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours (overnight is best).
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Place chicken on a rack and bake for 25-30 minutes, turning once.
Brush with oil/butter and grill for 2-3 minutes for a charred effect.
Serve with onion rings, lemon wedges, and mint chutney.

recipes.name: Rajma Masala
instructions: Pressure cook rajma until very soft.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add all spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add cooked rajma and some water. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Mash some rajma with the back of a spoon to thicken the gravy.
Garnish with coriander. Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Pani Puri
instructions: For pani: Blend mint, coriander, green chilies, and spices with water. Strain.
Add black salt, chaat masala, and jaggery. Adjust taste. Chill.
For filling: Mix mashed potatoes and chickpeas with a little salt and chaat masala.
Make a hole in each puri. Fill with potato-chickpea mixture.
Add a little tamarind chutney.
Dip in the chilled mint water and eat immediately.

recipes.name: Malai Kofta
ingredients: For Koftas: Paneer, Potatoes, Cornflour, Cashews, Raisins
For Gravy: Onions, Tomatoes, Cashew Paste, Cream, Butter
instructions: For koftas: Grate and mix paneer, boiled potatoes, and cornflour. Shape into balls with a cashew and raisin inside. Deep-fry until golden. Set aside.
For gravy: Sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Blend into a smooth paste. Return to pan, add cashew paste and spices.
Add cream and butter. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add koftas just before serving. Garnish with more cream.
Serve with naan or jeera rice.

recipes.name: Chana Masala
instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas with tea leaves until soft. Drain.
Heat oil, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until mushy.
Add all spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas and water. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Mash some chickpeas to thicken the gravy.
Finish with amchur powder and a sprinkle of garam masala.
Garnish with onions and coriander. Serve with bhatura or rice.

recipes.name: Rava Dosa
instructions: Mix rava, rice flour, maida, and salt in a bowl.
Add water gradually to make a thin, flowing batter.
Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, coriander, pepper, and cumin seeds. Rest for 15-20 minutes.
Heat a non-stick tawa. Pour the batter from the outside in a circular motion to form a thin, lacy dosa.
Drizzle oil around the edges. Cook on medium-high heat until crisp and golden.
Flip and cook for a minute. No need to cook the other side if you like it crisp.
Serve immediately with sambar and chutney.

recipes.name: Fish Curry (Goan)
instructions: Soak red chilies, coriander seeds, cumin, and tamarind in hot water for 15 minutes.
Grind into a smooth paste with garlic and turmeric.
Heat coconut oil, sauté onions until soft.
Add the ground paste and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add coconut milk and water. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Add fish pieces and salt. Cook for 8-10 minutes on low heat until fish is cooked.
Do not boil vigorously after adding fish.
Garnish with coriander. Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Matar Paneer
ingredients: 1 cup Green Peas (Matar), fresh or frozen
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add all dry spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add green peas and a little water. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with garam masala and coriander leaves.
Serve hot with roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Vada Pav
instructions: For vada: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, and turmeric. Sauté for a minute.
Add mashed potatoes and salt. Mix well. Cool and shape into balls.
Make a batter with besan, salt, and water (coatting consistency).
Dip potato balls in batter and deep-fry until golden brown.
Slice pav, spread chutneys, place vada inside.
Serve with fried green chilies and more chutney.

recipes.name: Kadhi Pakora
instructions: For pakoras: Mix besan, onion, and spices with water. Make small pakoras and deep-fry. Set aside.
For kadhi: Mix besan and yogurt with water until smooth.
Heat ghee, add fenugreek seeds until fragrant.
Add yogurt-besan mixture, turmeric, chilli powder, and salt.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously until thickened.
Add water to desired consistency. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add pakoras just before serving.
Serve with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chicken 65
instructions: Marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste, red chilli paste, soy sauce, and vinegar for 2 hours.
Add cornflour and rice flour. Mix well.
Deep fry chicken in hot oil until crispy and cooked.
In another pan, temper curry leaves in oil.
Add fried chicken and toss well.
Serve hot as appetizer or with biryani.

recipes.name: Mutton Korma
instructions: Marinate mutton in yogurt and spices for 2 hours.
Heat ghee, fry onions until golden brown. Remove half for garnish.
Add ginger-garlic paste and marinated mutton. Brown the meat.
Add cashew and poppy seed pastes. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add water, cover and simmer until meat is tender (1-1.5 hours).
Finish with garam masala and saffron.
Garnish with fried onions. Serve with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Besan Chilla
instructions: Mix besan with water to make a smooth batter.
Add all vegetables, spices, and salt. Mix well.
Heat tawa, pour ladleful of batter and spread like pancake.
Drizzle oil around edges. Cook until golden both sides.
Serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

recipes.name: Egg Curry
instructions: Make slits on boiled eggs for better flavor absorption.
Heat oil, add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add all spices and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add water and bring to simmer.
Add boiled eggs and cook for 10 minutes.
Garnish with coriander. Serve with rice or roti.

recipes.name: Dhokla
ingredients: For Tempering: Mustard Seeds, Curry Leaves
instructions: Mix besan, sooji, ginger-chilli paste, lemon juice, sugar, and salt.
Add water to make pouring consistency batter. Rest for 1-2 hours.
Grease a steaming plate. Add fruit salt to batter and mix gently.
Pour batter immediately into plate and steam for 15-20 minutes.
Check with toothpick - if it comes out clean, it's done.
For tempering: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Pour tempering over dhokla. Cut into pieces.
Serve with green chutney.

recipes.name: Kolkata Biryani
instructions: Parboil rice with whole spices. Drain and set aside.
Marinate meat in yogurt and spices for 2 hours.
Boil potatoes until partially cooked.
In heavy pot, layer meat, rice, potatoes, and boiled eggs.
Sprinkle rose water, saffron milk, and ghee.
Seal with dough and cook on dum for 30 minutes.
Let it rest for 15 minutes before serving.
Serve with biryani raita.

recipes.name: Masala Karela
instructions: Scrape karela skin, remove seeds, and slice.
Rub with salt and keep aside for 30 minutes. Squeeze out bitter water.
Heat oil, sauté karela until slightly crisp. Remove.
In same oil, add fennel seeds, then onions.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook until soft.
Add fried karela and jaggery. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add amchur powder at the end.
Serve with roti or paratha.

recipes.name: Appam with Stew
ingredients: For Stew: Mixed Vegetables, Coconut Milk
instructions: Soak raw rice for 6 hours. Grind with cooked rice, coconut, and yeast.
Ferment batter overnight until bubbly.
Heat appam pan, pour ladleful batter and swirl to spread.
Cover and cook until edges are crisp and center is soft.
For stew: Cook vegetables in coconut milk with green chilies and curry leaves.
Season with mustard seeds and coconut oil.
Serve hot appam with vegetable stew.

recipes.name: Chicken Chettinad
instructions: Dry roast red chilies, coriander seeds, fennel, and pepper.
Grind with coconut to make Chettinad masala paste.
Heat coconut oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add masala paste and cook for 5 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add chicken pieces and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add water and simmer until chicken is tender.
Serve hot with appam or dosa.

recipes.name: Misi Roti
instructions: Mix both flours, methi leaves, and all spices.
Add yogurt and oil. Knead into stiff dough using water.
Rest dough for 15-20 minutes.
Divide into balls and roll into thick rotis.
Cook on tawa with little oil until golden both sides.
Serve hot with pickle or yogurt.

recipes.name: Prawn Malai Curry
instructions: Marinate prawns with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat mustard oil until smoking. Cool slightly.
Sauté onion paste until golden.
Add ginger paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add coconut milk, sugar, and green chilies. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add prawns and cook for 8-10 minutes until done.
Do not overcook prawns.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Kulfi
instructions: Mix cornflour with 1/4 cup milk. Set aside.
Boil remaining milk, reduce to half, stirring continuously.
Add sugar and khoya. Mix well.
Add cornflour mixture and cook until thickened.
Add cardamom powder, nuts, and saffron.
Cool completely and pour into kulfi molds.
Freeze for 6-8 hours or overnight.
Serve garnished with more nuts.

recipes.name: Kadhi Chawal
instructions: Make small besan pakoras and deep fry. Set aside.
Mix besan and yogurt with water until smooth.
Heat ghee, add fenugreek seeds until fragrant.
Add yogurt-besan mixture and spices.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously until thickened.
Add water to desired consistency. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add pakoras just before serving.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in tikka marinade for 4 hours. Grill until cooked.
Heat butter, sauté onion paste until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook until oil separates.
Add tikka masala, sugar, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add grilled chicken tikka pieces and kasuri methi.
Simmer for 5 minutes. Do not boil.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

recipes.name: Sarson Ka Saag
instructions: Clean and chop all greens. Pressure cook with green chilies until soft.
Mash the cooked greens coarsely.
Add maize flour and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In separate pan, heat ghee, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add this tempering to the saag. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with makki di roti and white butter.

recipes.name: Pesarattu
ingredients: 2 cups Whole Green Gram (Moong Dal), soaked
instructions: Grind soaked moong dal with green chilies, ginger, and cumin to a coarse batter.
Add rice flour and salt. Mix well.
Heat tawa, pour batter and spread like dosa.
Drizzle oil and cook until crisp both sides.
Serve with ginger chutney or allam pachadi.

recipes.name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
instructions: Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and prick with fork.
Deep fry until golden. Set aside.
Whisk yogurt with fennel powder, ginger powder, and chilli powder.
Heat ghee, add asafoetida, then yogurt mixture.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously until oil separates.
Add water, salt, and fried potatoes.
Simmer on low heat (dum) for 15-20 minutes.
Garnish with coriander. Serve with rice or naan.

recipes.name: Bombay Sandwich
instructions: Butter all bread slices on one side.
Spread green chutney on two slices.
Layer with potato slices, cucumber, tomato, and onion.
Sprinkle chaat masala and salt.
Cover with other bread slices, butter side up.
Grill in sandwich maker until golden and crisp.
Cut into triangles and serve with ketchup.

recipes.name: Laal Maas
instructions: Soak red chilies in hot water for 20 minutes. Grind to paste.
Heat ghee, sauté onions until dark brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and mutton. Brown the meat.
Add chilli paste and spices. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add yogurt and cook until oil separates.
Add water, cover and simmer until meat is tender (1-1.5 hours).
Serve hot with bajra roti or rice.

recipes.name: Medu Vada
instructions: Soak urad dal for 4-6 hours. Drain completely.
Grind to a smooth, fluffy batter with minimal water.
Add green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, pepper, and salt.
Add rice flour and mix well.
Wet hands, shape batter into doughnut shapes with hole in center.
Deep fry in medium-hot oil until golden and crisp.
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney.

recipes.name: Gajar Ka Halwa
instructions: Cook grated carrots in milk on medium heat, stirring frequently.
Cook until milk is completely absorbed and carrots are soft.
Add ghee and cook for 10 minutes, stirring continuously.
Add sugar and cook until moisture evaporates.
In separate pan, fry cashews and raisins in ghee until golden.
Add to halwa along with cardamom powder.
Serve hot or cold, garnished with more nuts.

recipes.name: Chicken Lollipop
instructions: Make cuts on chicken lollipops for better marination.
Marinate with soy sauce, vinegar, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours.
Mix cornflour and all-purpose flour. Coat lollipops well.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
For sauce: Stir-fry with chilli sauce and spring onions (optional).
Serve hot with schezwan sauce or mayonnaise.

recipes.name: Mysore Pak
instructions: Sieve gram flour to remove lumps.
Heat ghee in a separate pan and keep warm.
Make one-string sugar syrup with sugar and water.
Reduce heat, gradually add gram flour to syrup, stirring continuously.
Add warm ghee gradually while stirring vigorously.
Cook until mixture leaves sides of pan and becomes porous.
Pour into greased tray and sprinkle cardamom powder and nuts.
Cut into pieces when slightly cooled. Store airtight.

recipes.name: Masala Chai
instructions: Crush ginger and cardamoms lightly.
Boil water with all spices for 3-4 minutes.
Add tea leaves and boil for 1 minute.
Add milk and sugar. Boil until it rises.
Simmer for 2 minutes for richer flavor.
Strain and serve hot.
Best enjoyed with biscuits or snacks.

recipes.name: Kachori
instructions: Make dough with flour, ghee, and water. Rest for 30 minutes.
Grind soaked urad dal coarsely.
Heat oil, add fennel, coriander seeds, and asafoetida.
Add ground dal and spices. Cook for 5 minutes. Cool.
Stuff dough balls with filling and roll into kachoris.
Deep fry on medium heat until golden and puffed.
Serve with tamarind chutney or potato curry.

recipes.name: Prawn Biryani
instructions: Marinate prawns in yogurt and spices for 30 minutes.
Parboil rice with whole spices. Drain.
Fry onions until golden brown.
Layer rice, prawn masala, fried onions, and mint.
Add saffron milk and ghee.
Seal and cook on dum for 20 minutes.
Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.
Serve with raita.

recipes.name: Aloo Tikki
instructions: Mash potatoes well. Add all spices and cornflour.
Mix thoroughly and shape into round tikkis.
Shallow fry until golden and crisp on both sides.
Serve hot with green chutney and tamarind chutney.
