Can also be used for chaat with curd and sev.

recipes.name: Mutton Rogan Josh
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoking. Cool slightly.
Brown mutton pieces. Remove and set aside.
In same oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and all spices.
Add yogurt and cook until oil separates.
Add mutton and water. Simmer for 1-1.5 hours.
Garnish with coriander. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Rasgulla
instructions: Boil milk. Add lemon juice to curdle.
Strain through muslin cloth. Rinse with cold water.
Hang for 30 minutes to remove excess water.
Knead paneer until smooth. Add flour and knead again.
Make small smooth balls.
Make one-string sugar syrup with sugar and water.
Gently drop paneer balls in simmering syrup.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes until spongy.
Add rose water. Chill before serving.

recipes.name: Khaman Dhokla
ingredients: For Tempering: Mustard Seeds, Curry Leaves
instructions: Mix besan, semolina, sugar, salt, and lemon juice.
Add water to make pouring consistency batter.
Rest for 1-2 hours.
Add Eno and mix gently. Steam immediately for 15 minutes.
Check with toothpick. Cool and cut into pieces.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Garnish with coconut and coriander.
Serve with green chutney.

recipes.name: Chicken Kosha
instructions: Heat mustard oil until smoking. Cool slightly.
Caramelize onions until dark brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add chicken and brown on high heat.
Add spices, sugar, and salt. Cook on low heat for 30-40 minutes.
Add little water if needed. Cook until gravy is thick.
Serve with luchi or paratha.

recipes.name: Methi Malai Mutter
instructions: Blanch methi leaves in hot water to reduce bitterness.
Heat butter, sauté onion paste until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add cashew paste and cook for 3 minutes.
Add methi leaves and peas. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add cream, sugar, and salt. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Do not boil after adding cream.
Serve hot with naan or paratha.

recipes.name: Kolkata Kathi Roll
instructions: Marinate chicken/paneer with soya sauce and vinegar for 30 minutes.
Stir-fry with onions and capsicum until cooked.
Beat egg with salt. Spread on tawa, place paratha on top.
Cook until egg sets and paratha is heated.
Place filling on paratha, squeeze lemon juice.
Roll tightly and wrap in paper.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

recipes.name: Shrikhand
ingredients: 2 cups Greek Yogurt or Hung Curd
instructions: Hang yogurt in muslin cloth for 4-6 hours to remove whey.
Soak saffron in warm milk for 15 minutes.
Whisk hung curd until smooth and creamy.
Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron milk.
Mix well until sugar dissolves completely.
Chill for 2-3 hours.
Garnish with chopped nuts before serving.
Serve chilled as dessert or with puri.

recipes.name: Egg Bhurji
instructions: Beat eggs with salt and keep aside.
Heat oil, sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute.
Add tomatoes and spices. Cook until tomatoes are soft.
Pour beaten eggs and scramble on medium heat.
Cook until eggs are done but still moist.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
Serve hot with toast or paratha.

recipes.name: Punjabi Lassi
instructions: Blend yogurt, sugar, and cardamom powder until smooth.
Add chilled water and blend until frothy.
Add ice cubes and blend briefly.
Pour into glasses.
Garnish with cream and chopped pistachios.
Serve immediately.
For salted lassi, replace sugar with salt and add roasted cumin.

recipes.name: Chicken Reshmi Kabab
instructions: Mix all ingredients except oil in a bowl.
Marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Shape into seekh kababs or round patties.
Grill in oven or on tawa until cooked through.
Brush with oil while cooking.
Cook until golden brown and slightly charred.
Serve hot with mint chutney and onion rings.

recipes.name: Mango Pickle
instructions: Wash and dry mangoes thoroughly. Cut into cubes.
Dry roast fenugreek and fennel seeds. Powder coarsely.
Mix all spices with salt in a bowl.
Add mango pieces and mix well with spices.
Heat mustard oil until smoking. Cool completely.
Add cooled oil to mango-spice mixture.
Store in sterilized jars in sunlight for 4-5 days.
Ready to eat after a week. Stays good for a year.

recipes.name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Drain.
Heat ghee, add whole spices until fragrant.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add rice and water (1:2 ratio).
Add salt and bring to boil.
Cover and cook on low heat until rice is done.
Fluff with fork. Serve with raita.

recipes.name: Chicken Kolhapuri
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add Kolhapuri masala and cook for 2 minutes.
Add chicken and brown on high heat.
Add coconut and water. Simmer until chicken is tender.
Finish with goda masala.
Garnish with coriander.
Serve hot with bhakri or rice.

recipes.name: Moong Dal Halwa
instructions: Grind soaked dal to coarse paste with minimal water.
Heat ghee in heavy bottom pan.
Add dal paste and cook on low heat, stirring continuously.
Cook until dal turns golden and ghee separates.
Add khoya and cook for 10 minutes.
Add sugar and cook until melted.
Add cardamom powder and nuts.
Serve hot garnished with more nuts.

recipes.name: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil all vegetables until soft. Mash coarsely.
Heat butter, sauté onions until translucent.
Add ginger-garlic paste, capsicum, and tomatoes. Cook until soft.
Add pav bhaji masala and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add mashed vegetables and water. Simmer for 10 minutes.
For pav: Slice and toast with butter on a griddle.
Garnish bhaji with butter, coriander, and lemon. Serve with pav.

recipes.name: Rasmalai
ingredients: 1 liter Full Cream Milk for Paneer
instructions: Make paneer from milk using lemon juice.
Hang for 30 minutes. Knead until smooth.
Make small flat discs.
Make sugar syrup with sugar and water.
Boil paneer discs in syrup for 15-20 minutes until spongy.
For rabri: Boil milk until reduced to half. Add sugar and cardamom.
Soak paneer discs in rabri for 4-6 hours.
Garnish with nuts and saffron. Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes until pliable but firm.
Heat oil in wok, add minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken/shrimp and cook until done.
Push ingredients to one side, crack eggs and scramble.
Add drained noodles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
Toss everything together and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add bean sprouts and stir briefly.
Garnish with crushed peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

recipes.name: Tom Yum Goong
instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil in a pot.
Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chilies. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add mushrooms and onion, cook for 3 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until pink (2-3 minutes).
Remove from heat, add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar.
Adjust seasoning to balance sour, salty, and spicy.
Garnish with cilantro and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Green Curry (Gaeng Keow Wan)
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream in a pan, add green curry paste and fry until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until sealed.
Add remaining coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add eggplant and kaffir lime leaves, cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add Thai basil and chilies just before serving.
Serve with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad)
instructions: Peel and shred green papaya using a shredder or knife.
In a mortar, pound garlic and chilies until crushed.
Add long beans and lightly pound to bruise.
Add tomatoes and gently crush to release juices.
Add shredded papaya, dried shrimp, and peanuts.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar.
Pound and mix everything together until well combined.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Massaman Curry
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add meat and brown on all sides.
Add remaining coconut milk and spices (cinnamon, cardamom).
Simmer for 1 hour until meat is tender.
Add potatoes and onions, cook for 20 minutes.
Add peanuts, fish sauce, palm sugar, and tamarind.
Simmer for 10 more minutes.
Serve with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Pad Kra Pao (Holy Basil Stir-fry)
instructions: Pound garlic and chilies in mortar until coarse paste.
Heat oil in wok, add garlic-chili paste and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add minced meat and break it up while cooking.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Stir-fry until meat is cooked through.
Add holy basil leaves and stir briefly until wilted.
Serve over rice with a fried egg on top.

recipes.name: Tom Kha Gai (Coconut Chicken Soup)
instructions: Bring coconut milk and chicken stock to simmer.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add chicken and mushrooms, cook until chicken is done.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, and chilies.
Adjust seasoning to balance flavors.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

recipes.name: Panang Curry
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add meat and cook until sealed.
Add remaining coconut milk and simmer until meat is tender.
Add bell pepper and cook for 3 minutes.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves and peanuts.
Garnish with Thai basil. Serve with rice.

recipes.name: Mango Sticky Rice (Khao Niew Mamuang)
instructions: Soak glutinous rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Steam rice for 20-25 minutes until cooked.
Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt until sugar dissolves.
Pour 3/4 of coconut milk over hot rice and let it absorb for 30 minutes.
Mix remaining coconut milk with rice flour, cook until thickened for sauce.
Serve rice with mango slices and drizzle with coconut sauce.
Garnish with toasted mung beans.

recipes.name: Satay (Grilled Meat Skewers)
instructions: Marinate meat with curry powder, turmeric, coconut milk, fish sauce, and sugar for 2 hours.
Thread meat onto skewers.
Grill over medium heat until cooked through, turning occasionally.
For peanut sauce: Fry curry paste in coconut milk until fragrant.
Add peanut butter, fish sauce, tamarind, and sugar. Simmer until thickened.
Stir in crushed peanuts.
Serve satay with peanut sauce and cucumber relish.

recipes.name: Pad See Ew (Stir-fried Wide Noodles)
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until pliable but firm.
Heat oil in wok, add garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add meat and cook until done.
Push ingredients aside, add eggs and scramble.
Add noodles, both soy sauces, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until noodles are cooked.
Add Chinese broccoli and stir briefly until wilted.
Season with white pepper. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Yum Woon Sen (Glass Noodle Salad)
instructions: Soak glass noodles in warm water for 15 minutes. Drain.
Boil noodles for 2 minutes until transparent. Drain and cool.
Cook shrimp and minced pork until done. Cool.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar until sugar dissolves.
Combine noodles, meats, chilies, garlic, and herbs in a bowl.
Add dressing and toss well.
Garnish with shallots and additional herbs.
Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Khao Soi (Northern Thai Curry Noodles)
ingredients: For garnish: Pickled mustard, shallots, lime, chilies oil
instructions: Heat oil, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add meat and brown on all sides.
Add coconut milk and chicken stock. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Cook egg noodles according to package directions.
Season curry with fish sauce, soy sauce, and palm sugar.
Serve noodles in bowls, ladle curry over.
Garnish with crispy noodles, pickled mustard, shallots, and lime.
Drizzle with chili oil if desired.

recipes.name: Laab (Spicy Minced Meat Salad)
instructions: Dry toast glutinous rice until golden brown, then grind to powder.
Cook minced meat in a pan until done, breaking up lumps.
Remove from heat, add toasted rice powder.
Add lime juice, fish sauce, and chili powder. Mix well.
Add shallots, spring onions, mint, and cilantro.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve with fresh vegetables and sticky rice.

recipes.name: Gaeng Daeng (Red Curry)
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry red curry paste until oil separates.
Add meat and cook until sealed.
Add remaining coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add eggplant and kaffir lime leaves, cook until tender.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add Thai basil and chilies just before serving.
Serve with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Pla Rad Prik (Crispy Fish with Chili Sauce)
instructions: Score fish on both sides and coat with rice flour.
Deep fry fish until crispy and cooked through.
In a separate pan, fry garlic, chilies, and shallots until fragrant.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar. Cook until slightly thickened.
Pour sauce over crispy fish.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Khanom Krok (Coconut Rice Pancakes)
ingredients: For topping: Coconut cream, Spring onions, Corn
instructions: Mix rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Add water to make thin batter. Ferment for 2 hours.
Heat special khanom krok pan.
Pour batter into holes, about 2/3 full.
Add toppings like coconut cream, spring onions, or corn.
Cover and cook until edges are crispy.
Put two halves together to form a ball.
Serve warm.

recipes.name: Yam Talay (Seafood Salad)
instructions: Clean and prepare seafood. Boil until just cooked. Drain and cool.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar until sugar dissolves.
Combine seafood with chilies, shallots, and lemongrass.
Add dressing and toss gently.
Add mint and cilantro just before serving.
Serve with lime wedges.
Can be served at room temperature or chilled.

recipes.name: Khao Pad (Thai Fried Rice)
ingredients: Lime wedges and cucumber for serving
instructions: Heat oil in wok, add garlic and onion. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Add meat and cook until done.
Push ingredients aside, add eggs and scramble.
Add rice and break up any clumps.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar. Mix well.
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until rice is heated through.
Add spring onions and mix briefly.
Serve with lime wedges and cucumber slices.

recipes.name: Gaeng Som (Sour Curry)
instructions: Bring water to boil in a pot.
Add gaeng som paste and stir until dissolved.
Add bamboo shoots and cook for 10 minutes.
Add fish fillets and cook until done.
Add tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
Add Chinese cabbage and kaffir lime leaves.
Simmer for 5 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Adjust seasoning and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Kai Jeow (Thai Omelette)
instructions: Beat eggs with fish sauce, soy sauce, water, and white pepper.
Add minced pork and spring onions if using.
Heat oil in wok until very hot.
Pour egg mixture into hot oil.
Let it puff up for 30 seconds before stirring.
Flip and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Serve with jasmine rice and sriracha sauce.

recipes.name: Tom Saap (Spicy Pork Rib Soup)
instructions: Bring water to boil in a large pot.
Add pork ribs and simmer for 30 minutes until tender.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves.
Simmer for another 10 minutes.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and chilies.
Adjust seasoning to balance sour, salty, and spicy.
Garnish with cilantro and shallots.
Serve hot with sticky rice.

recipes.name: Khanom Buang (Thai Crispy Pancakes)
ingredients: For filling: Sweet or savory toppings
instructions: Mix rice flour, all-purpose flour, and salt.
Add coconut milk and eggs to make smooth batter.
Heat special khanom buang pan with little oil.
Pour small amount of batter and spread thinly.
Cook until crispy and golden.
Add sweet filling (coconut cream) or savory filling.
Fold in half and remove from pan.
Serve immediately while crispy.

recipes.name: Pla Kapong Neung Manao (Steamed Fish with Lime)
instructions: Clean fish and make diagonal cuts on both sides.
Place fish on steaming plate with lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves.
Steam for 10-15 minutes until cooked through.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, and chilies for sauce.
When fish is cooked, pour sauce over it.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Khao Niew Sangkhaya (Sticky Rice with Coconut Custard)
instructions: Soak glutinous rice for 4 hours or overnight.
Steam rice for 20-25 minutes until cooked.
Beat eggs with coconut milk, palm sugar, and salt.
Strain the custard mixture.
Add pandan leaves for flavor.
Steam custard over low heat for 20 minutes until set.
Serve warm sticky rice with coconut custard on top.
Can be served in small pumpkin or coconut.

recipes.name: Moo Ping (Grilled Pork Skewers)
instructions: Slice pork into thin strips against the grain.
Mix all marinade ingredients in a bowl.
Marinate pork for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Thread pork onto soaked bamboo skewers.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally.
Baste with remaining marinade while grilling.
Grill until cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve with sticky rice and cucumber relish.

recipes.name: Pad Pak Boong (Stir-fried Water Spinach)
ingredients: 1 tbsp Oyster Sauce (or vegetarian oyster sauce)
instructions: Wash water spinach and cut into 2-inch pieces.
Heat oil in wok until very hot.
Add garlic and chilies, stir-fry until fragrant.
Add water spinach and stir-fry quickly.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Add 1 tbsp water to create steam.
Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until wilted but still crisp.
Serve immediately as a side dish.

recipes.name: Hor Mok (Steamed Fish Curry)
instructions: Mix minced fish with red curry paste.
Add eggs, coconut milk, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
Mix until well combined and slightly sticky.
Prepare banana leaf cups or use small bowls.
Place kaffir lime leaves at the bottom.
Spoon fish mixture into containers.
Steam for 15-20 minutes until set.
Garnish with coconut cream and chili.

recipes.name: Khao Kluk Kapi (Shrimp Paste Rice)
instructions: Heat oil, fry shrimp paste until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until done.
Add cooked rice and mix well with shrimp paste.
Fry until rice is evenly colored.
Fry shallots until crispy for garnish.
Serve rice with omelette strips, dried shrimp, and crispy shallots.
Accompany with cucumber, green mango, and lime.
Can add fresh chilies for extra heat.

recipes.name: Gaeng Jued (Clear Soup)
instructions: Bring vegetable stock to boil.
Add garlic, carrot, and cabbage.
Cook for 5 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Add tofu and glass noodles.
Season with soy sauce, sugar, and white pepper.
Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with spring onions.
Serve hot as a light meal.

recipes.name: Poo Pad Pong Karee (Crab in Yellow Curry)
instructions: Clean and prepare crabs, crack the shells.
Heat oil, fry curry powder until fragrant.
Add onions and stir-fry until soft.
Add crabs and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Add milk and simmer until crabs are cooked.
Push ingredients aside, add beaten eggs and scramble.
Mix everything together, garnish with spring onions.

recipes.name: Khanom Tom (Coconut Rice Balls)
instructions: Mix grated coconut with salt and steam for 10 minutes.
Melt palm sugar with little water to make syrup.
Mix rice flour with warm water to make dough.
Take small portions, flatten and add coconut filling.
Shape into balls and seal properly.
Boil in water until they float to surface.
Remove and coat with steamed grated coconut.
Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Yam Hua Plee (Banana Flower Salad)
instructions: Prepare banana flower by removing outer leaves.
Shred inner part and soak in acidulated water.
Drain well before using.
Mix lime juice, soy sauce, and sugar for dressing.
Combine banana flower with chilies and shallots.
Add dressing and toss well.
Add coconut milk and mix gently.
Garnish with peanuts and fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Pad Phed (Spicy Stir-fry)
instructions: Heat oil, fry red curry paste until fragrant.
Add meat and stir-fry until cooked.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add fish sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves and Thai basil.
Stir-fry until everything is well combined.
Add little water if too dry.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Khao Mok Gai (Thai Chicken Biryani)
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 2 hours.
Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.
Fry onions until golden brown for garnish.
Cook chicken with spices until tender.
Layer rice and chicken in a pot.
Add saffron water and ghee.
Cook on dum (sealed pot) for 20 minutes.
Garnish with fried onions and cilantro.

recipes.name: Tub Tim Grob (Red Rubies)
instructions: Cut water chestnuts into small cubes.
Mix with red food coloring and tapioca flour.
Boil in water until translucent and float.
Immediately transfer to ice water.
Make coconut syrup by heating coconut milk with sugar and salt.
Add pandan leaves for flavor.
Serve water chestnuts over crushed ice with coconut syrup.
Can add jackfruit or other fruits.

recipes.name: Pla Too Tod Kamin (Turmeric Fried Fish)
instructions: Clean fish and make diagonal cuts on both sides.
Mix turmeric, garlic, fish sauce, and sugar into paste.
Rub paste all over fish, inside and out.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in pan, fry fish until golden and crispy.
Turn carefully to cook both sides.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve with steamed rice and fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Khanom Chan (Layered Coconut Cake)
instructions: Mix flours with coconut milk, sugar, and salt.
Divide batter into portions for different colors.
Add pandan juice for green layer.
Steam first layer for 5 minutes until set.
Add next layer and steam again.
Repeat until all layers are used.
Let cool completely before cutting.
Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodles)
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until pliable.
Heat oil in wok, add garlic and chilies until fragrant.
Add meat and stir-fry until cooked.
Add bell pepper and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add noodles and all sauces.
Stir-fry quickly over high heat.
Add holy basil at the last moment.
Serve immediately while hot.

recipes.name: Gaeng Tai Pla (Southern Fish Kidney Curry)
instructions: Rinse tai pla to reduce saltiness if needed.
Heat oil, fry tai pla until fragrant.
Add chilies and stir-fry briefly.
Add water and bring to boil.
Add bamboo shoots and eggplant, simmer for 15 minutes.
Add fish and cook until done.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves before serving.

recipes.name: Khao Yam (Southern Rice Salad)
instructions: Prepare all vegetables and herbs - chop finely.
Toast grated coconut until golden brown.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar for dressing.
In a bowl, combine rice with all herbs and vegetables.
Add toasted coconut and dried shrimp if using.
Pour dressing over and mix gently.
Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve immediately as a refreshing meal.

recipes.name: Hoi Tod (Crispy Oyster Omelette)
instructions: Clean oysters thoroughly and drain.
Mix flours with water to make thin batter.
Heat generous amount of oil in pan.
Pour batter into hot oil, then add eggs.
Scramble eggs lightly, then add oysters.
Cook until edges are crispy and golden.
Flip and cook other side until crispy.
Serve with bean sprouts and chili sauce.

recipes.name: Nam Prik Ong (Northern Chili Dip)
instructions: Soak dried chilies in warm water until soft.
Pound chilies, garlic, and shallots into paste.
Heat oil, fry the chili paste until fragrant.
Add shrimp paste and stir briefly.
Add minced pork and break up while cooking.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Serve with fresh vegetables and sticky rice.

recipes.name: Khanom Jeen (Fermented Rice Noodles)
instructions: Prepare khanom jeen noodles (usually store-bought).
Make curry by frying nam prik paste in coconut milk.
Add fish and cook until flaky.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Prepare fresh vegetables - beans, cabbage, cucumber.
Serve noodles with curry and fresh vegetables.
Add hard-boiled eggs if desired.
Can be served warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pla Chon Lui Suan (Herbal Fish Salad)
instructions: Steam or boil fish until cooked, then flake.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar for dressing.
Combine fish with chilies and shallots.
Add dressing and mix gently.
Add all fresh herbs and toasted rice powder.
Toss lightly to combine.
Adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve immediately with fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Khao Kha Moo (Braised Pork Leg Rice)
instructions: Blanch pork leg in boiling water for 10 minutes.
In a large pot, combine water, soy sauces, and sugar.
Add garlic and spices (star anise, cinnamon).
Add pork leg and bring to boil.
Simmer for 2 hours until very tender.
Add hard-boiled eggs in the last 30 minutes.
Serve over rice with braising liquid.
Accompany with pickled mustard greens.

recipes.name: Miang Kham (Leaf Wraps)
ingredients: 20 Wild Betel Leaves or cabbage leaves
For sauce: Palm sugar, tamarind, fish sauce
instructions: Prepare all ingredients - dice into small pieces.
Arrange separately in small bowls.
Make sauce by melting palm sugar with tamarind and fish sauce.
Cook until thickened and syrupy.
To serve: Each person takes a leaf.
Add small amounts of each ingredient.
Top with a spoonful of sauce.
Wrap and eat in one bite.

recipes.name: Pad Pak Ruam (Mixed Vegetables Stir-fry)
instructions: Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil in wok, add garlic until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables first (carrots, broccoli).
Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add softer vegetables and tofu.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Mix cornstarch with water, add to thicken sauce.
Serve hot as a side dish.

recipes.name: Kai Yang (Grilled Chicken)
instructions: Pound garlic, lemongrass, and coriander roots into paste.
Mix with fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, and pepper.
Rub marinade all over chicken, inside and out.
Marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally.
Baste with remaining marinade while grilling.
Grill until cooked through and skin is crispy.
Serve with sticky rice and som tum.

recipes.name: Khanom Mo Kaeng (Custard Square)
instructions: Beat eggs with coconut milk until smooth.
Add palm sugar and salt, mix until dissolved.
Add rice flour and mix well.
Strain the mixture to remove lumps.
Pour into square baking pan.
Top with sliced onions and fried shallots.
Bake at 350°F (180°C) for 40-45 minutes.
Cool before cutting into squares.

recipes.name: Pla Muk Pad Ped (Spicy Stir-fried Squid)
instructions: Clean squid and score the inside in crisscross pattern.
Cut into bite-sized pieces.
Heat oil, fry red curry paste until fragrant.
Add onion and bell pepper, stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add squid and stir-fry quickly until curled.
Add fish sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Add basil and kaffir lime leaves.
Serve immediately over rice.

recipes.name: Khao Chae (Royal Summer Rice)
ingredients: For side dishes: Stuffed shallots, sweet beef, etc.
instructions: Wash rice and soak in jasmine-scented water overnight.
Steam rice until cooked but firm.
Cool rice completely.
Prepare various side dishes (this is the complex part).
To serve: Place rice in bowl with ice water.
Add jasmine flowers for fragrance.
Serve with assortment of side dishes.
Eat by taking small amounts with rice and water.

recipes.name: Nam Prik Num (Northern Green Chili Dip)
instructions: Grill chilies, garlic, shallots, and tomatoes until charred.
Remove skins from tomatoes and chilies if desired.
Pound all ingredients in mortar until coarse paste.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar.
Mix well and adjust seasoning.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve with fresh vegetables and pork rinds.
Can be stored for several days.

recipes.name: Khanom Bueang (Thai Crispy Pancakes)
ingredients: For filling: Sweet or savory toppings
instructions: Mix flours with salt and coconut milk.
Add eggs and mix until smooth batter.
Heat special khanom bueang pan with little oil.
Pour small amount of batter and spread thinly.
Cook until crispy and golden brown.
Add sweet filling (coconut cream) or savory filling.
Fold in half and remove from pan.
Serve immediately while crispy.

recipes.name: Yam Naem Khao Thod (Crispy Rice Salad)
instructions: Form sticky rice into patties and deep fry until crispy.
Break up crispy rice into small pieces.
Slice sour sausage and fry until cooked.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar for dressing.
Combine crispy rice, sausage, and dried shrimp.
Add shallots, chilies, and fresh herbs.
Add dressing and toss gently.
Serve immediately with fresh vegetables.

recipes.name: Khao Niew Dam (Black Sticky Rice)
instructions: Soak black rice overnight or at least 4 hours.
Drain and steam for 30-40 minutes until cooked.
Heat coconut milk with palm sugar and salt.
Stir until sugar dissolves completely.
Mix sweet coconut milk with cooked black rice.
Let it sit for 30 minutes to absorb flavors.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
Garnish with toasted sesame seeds.

recipes.name: Poo Ja (Stuffed Crab Shells)
instructions: Clean crab shells thoroughly.
Mix crab meat with minced pork.
Pound coriander roots and garlic into paste.
Add to meat mixture with seasonings.
Add egg and breadcrumbs to bind.
Stuff mixture into crab shells.
Steam for 10 minutes to set.
Deep fry until golden and crispy.

recipes.name: Gaeng Khua Hua Plee (Banana Heart Curry)
instructions: Prepare banana heart by removing outer leaves and soaking in acidulated water.
Slice the tender inner part.
Heat oil, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add thick coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add banana heart and cook for 10 minutes.
Add fish and cook until done.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves before serving.

recipes.name: Kai Palo (Five-spice Braised Eggs)
instructions: Hard boil eggs, peel and set aside.
In a pot, combine all ingredients except eggs.
Bring to boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Add hard-boiled eggs and continue simmering for 15 minutes.
The eggs should turn brown from the soy sauce.
Adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve with jasmine rice and pickled vegetables.
The sauce should be rich and slightly sweet.

recipes.name: Yam Som O (Pomelo Salad)
instructions: Peel pomelo and separate into segments, removing membranes.
Gently break into bite-sized pieces.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar for dressing.
Combine pomelo with cooked shrimp and dried shrimp.
Add toasted coconut and peanuts.
Add dressing and toss gently.
Add fresh herbs and chilies last.
Serve immediately while fresh.

recipes.name: Khanom Jin Nam Ya (Fish Curry with Rice Noodles)
instructions: Prepare khanom jin noodles according to package.
Make curry by frying nam ya paste in coconut milk.
Add fish and cook until flaky.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves for fragrance.
Prepare fresh vegetables - beans, cabbage, cucumber.
Serve noodles with curry and fresh vegetables.
Add hard-boiled eggs if desired.

recipes.name: Moo Satay (Pork Satay)
instructions: Slice pork into thin strips against the grain.
Mix all marinade ingredients in a bowl.
Marinate pork for at least 2 hours.
Thread pork onto soaked bamboo skewers.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally.
Baste with remaining marinade while grilling.
Grill until cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve with peanut sauce and cucumber relish.

recipes.name: Pad Phak Kat Kana (Stir-fried Chinese Broccoli)
instructions: Wash Chinese broccoli and cut into 2-inch pieces.
Separate stems from leaves as stems take longer to cook.
Heat oil in wok, add garlic until fragrant.
Add meat and stir-fry until cooked.
Add broccoli stems first, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add leaves and water to create steam.
Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Stir-fry until broccoli is tender but still crisp.

recipes.name: Khanom Krok Bai Toey (Pandan Coconut Cups)
ingredients: Pandan leaves for juice and flavor
For topping: Coconut cream, sweet corn
instructions: Extract pandan juice by blending leaves with water.
Mix rice flour with coconut milk, sugar, and salt.
Add pandan juice for green color and flavor.
Add water to make thin batter. Rest for 2 hours.
Heat khanom krok pan.
Pour batter into holes, about 2/3 full.
Add toppings like coconut cream or corn.
Cover and cook until edges are crispy.

recipes.name: Pla Sam Rod (Three-flavor Fish)
instructions: Score fish on both sides and deep fry until crispy.
In a separate pan, fry garlic, chilies, and shallots.
Add tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
Cook until sauce thickens slightly.
Pour sauce over crispy fish.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
The three flavors should be balanced: sour, sweet, salty.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Khao Tom (Rice Soup)
instructions: Bring chicken stock to boil.
Add garlic and ginger, simmer for 5 minutes.
Add meat and cook until done.
Add cooked rice and break up any clumps.
Season with fish sauce and soy sauce.
Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Garnish with spring onions and cilantro.
Serve hot as a light meal.

recipes.name: Nam Prik Pla Too (Mackerel Chili Dip)
instructions: Drain excess oil from canned mackerel.
Steam mackerel for 5 minutes to heat through.
Pound chilies, garlic, and shallots in mortar.
Add mackerel and pound until mixed but still chunky.
Add lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar.
Mix well and adjust seasoning.
Serve with fresh vegetables and steamed rice.
Can be stored in refrigerator for few days.

recipes.name: Khanom Tako (Coconut Pudding)
ingredients: Pandan leaves for flavor and color
instructions: Mix flours with coconut milk, sugar, and salt.
Divide batter into two portions.
Add pandan juice to one portion for green color.
Prepare pandan leaf cups or use small containers.
Steam white layer first for 10 minutes.
Add green layer and steam for another 10 minutes.
Cool completely before serving.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pad Cha (Spicy Jungle Stir-fry)
instructions: Heat oil in wok until very hot.
Add jungle curry paste and fry until fragrant.
Add meat and stir-fry until cooked.
Add fish sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Stir-fry quickly over high heat.
Add holy basil and kaffir lime leaves.
Add fresh peppercorns if using.
Serve immediately with rice.

recipes.name: Khanom La (Coconut Milk Jelly)
instructions: Mix flours with small amount of coconut milk to make paste.
Heat remaining coconut milk with sugar and salt.
Add pandan leaves for flavor.
When hot, add flour paste while stirring constantly.
Cook until mixture thickens.
Pour into serving containers.
Cool to room temperature, then refrigerate.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Poo Nim Pad Pong Karee (Soft-shell Crab in Curry)
instructions: Clean soft-shell crabs and pat dry.
Dust with flour and shallow fry until crispy.
Heat oil, fry curry powder until fragrant.
Add onions and stir-fry until soft.
Add fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Add milk and bring to simmer.
Push ingredients aside, add beaten eggs and scramble.
Add fried crabs, mix gently and garnish.

recipes.name: Khao Niew Mamuang Kati (Mango Sticky Rice)
instructions: Soak glutinous rice for at least 4 hours.
Steam rice for 20-25 minutes until cooked.
Heat coconut milk with sugar and salt until dissolved.
Pour 3/4 of coconut milk over hot rice.
Let rice absorb coconut milk for 30 minutes.
Mix remaining coconut milk with rice flour.
Cook until thickened for sauce.
Serve rice with mango slices and coconut sauce.

recipes.name: Yam Tua Poo (Winged Bean Salad)
instructions: Slice winged beans thinly on diagonal.
Blanch in boiling water for 1 minute, then cool.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar for dressing.
Combine winged beans with dried shrimp and peanuts.
Add shallots and chilies.
Add dressing and toss well.
Add fresh herbs just before serving.
Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Khanom Pang Na Goong (Shrimp Toast)
instructions: Remove crusts from bread slices.
Mix minced shrimp with garlic and coriander roots.
Add egg, fish sauce, sugar, and pepper.
Spread shrimp mixture thickly on bread.
Heat oil for shallow frying.
Fry shrimp-side down first until golden.
Flip and fry bread side until crisp.
Cut into triangles and serve with sweet chili sauce.

recipes.name: Gaeng Leung (Yellow Curry)
instructions: Heat oil, fry yellow curry paste until fragrant.
Add water and bring to boil.
Add bamboo shoots and cook for 10 minutes.
Add fish and cook until done.
Season with fish sauce, tamarind, and palm sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves.
Simmer for 5 more minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Khanom Tom Kati (Coconut Rice Balls in Syrup)
instructions: Mix grated coconut with salt.
Melt palm sugar with little water to make syrup.
Mix rice flour with warm water to make dough.
Take small portions, flatten and add coconut filling.
Shape into balls and seal properly.
Boil in water until they float to surface.
Remove and coat with coconut milk syrup.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Pad Thai Goong Sod (Fresh Shrimp Pad Thai)
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 20 minutes.
Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails on.
Heat oil, add garlic and tofu, fry until golden.
Add shrimp and cook until pink.
Push ingredients aside, add eggs and scramble.
Add drained noodles, tamarind, fish sauce, and sugar.
Toss everything together for 3-4 minutes.
Add bean sprouts, garnish with peanuts and lime.

recipes.name: Tom Yum Goong Nam Khon (Creamy Tom Yum)
instructions: Bring stock to boil with lemongrass, lime leaves, galangal.
Simmer for 10 minutes to infuse flavors.
Add mushrooms and shrimp, cook until shrimp are pink.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar.
Stir in evaporated milk for creaminess.
Drizzle with chili oil before serving.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately with rice.

recipes.name: Gaeng Keow Wan Nuea (Green Curry with Beef)
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add beef and sear on all sides.
Add remaining coconut milk, simmer for 30 minutes.
Add eggplant and kaffir lime leaves.
Cook until beef is tender and eggplant soft.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add Thai basil and chilies at the end.
Serve with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Som Tum Thai (Classic Green Papaya Salad)
instructions: Shred green papaya using traditional tool or grater.
In mortar, pound garlic and chilies until crushed.
Add long beans and lightly pound.
Add tomatoes and gently crush.
Add shredded papaya, dried shrimp, peanuts.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, tamarind, and sugar.
Pound and mix until well combined.
Adjust seasoning and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Massaman Nuea (Beef Massaman Curry)
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add beef and brown on all sides.
Add remaining coconut milk and whole spices.
Simmer for 1.5 hours until beef is tender.
Add potatoes and onions, cook for 20 minutes.
Add peanuts, fish sauce, palm sugar, and tamarind.
Simmer for 15 more minutes.
Serve with jasmine rice or roti.

recipes.name: Pad Kra Pao Moo Sap (Minced Pork with Holy Basil)
instructions: Pound garlic and chilies in mortar to coarse paste.
Heat oil in wok, add garlic-chili paste until fragrant.
Add pork mince and break up while cooking.
Add fish sauce, dark soy sauce, and sugar.
Stir-fry until pork is cooked through.
Add holy basil leaves and stir until wilted.
Fry eggs sunny-side up or over easy.
Serve over rice with fried egg on top.

recipes.name: Tom Kha Gai (Coconut Galangal Chicken Soup)
instructions: Bring coconut milk and stock to simmer.
Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves.
Simmer for 10 minutes to infuse flavors.
Add chicken and mushrooms, cook until chicken is done.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, and chilies.
Adjust seasoning to balance flavors.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve hot as a main dish.

recipes.name: Panang Nuea (Beef Panang Curry)
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry panang paste until fragrant.
Add beef and sear on all sides.
Add remaining coconut milk, simmer for 20 minutes.
Add bell pepper and cook for 5 minutes.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add kaffir lime leaves and peanuts.
Garnish with Thai basil.
Serve with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Khao Niew Mamuang (Classic Mango Sticky Rice)
instructions: Soak glutinous rice overnight or 4+ hours.
Steam rice for 20-25 minutes until tender.
Heat 1 cup coconut milk with 1/2 cup sugar and 3/4 tsp salt.
Pour over hot rice and let absorb for 30 minutes.
Make sauce with remaining coconut milk, sugar, salt, and tapioca flour.
Cook until thickened.
Slice mangoes and arrange with rice.
Drizzle with sauce and garnish with mung beans.

recipes.name: Gai Satay (Chicken Satay)
instructions: Slice chicken into thin strips.
Mix all marinade ingredients thoroughly.
Marinate chicken for 2+ hours or overnight.
Thread chicken onto soaked skewers.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally.
Baste with marinade while cooking.
Grill until cooked through with slight char.
Serve with peanut sauce and cucumber relish.

recipes.name: Pad See Ew Gai (Chicken with Wide Noodles)
instructions: Soak noodles in warm water until pliable.
Heat oil, add garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook through.
Push aside, add eggs and scramble.
Add noodles, both soy sauces, oyster sauce, and sugar.
Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until noodles are cooked.
Add Chinese broccoli and stir until wilted.
Season with white pepper and serve.

recipes.name: Yum Woon Sen Goong (Glass Noodle Shrimp Salad)
instructions: Soak glass noodles in warm water for 15 minutes.
Boil noodles for 2 minutes until transparent.
Cook shrimp until pink and cooked through.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar for dressing.
Combine noodles, shrimp, chilies, garlic, and herbs.
Add dressing and toss well.
Garnish with shallots and additional herbs.
Serve at room temperature.

recipes.name: Khao Soi Gai (Chicken Khao Soi)
instructions: Heat oil, fry curry paste until fragrant.
Add chicken and brown on all sides.
Add coconut milk and stock, simmer for 30 minutes.
Cook egg noodles according to package.
Season curry with fish sauce, soy sauce, and sugar.
Fry some noodles until crispy for garnish.
Serve noodles in bowls, ladle curry over.
Garnish with crispy noodles, pickles, and lime.

recipes.name: Laab Moo (Spicy Pork Salad)
instructions: Dry toast glutinous rice until golden, then grind to powder.
Cook pork mince in dry pan until done, breaking up lumps.
Remove from heat, add toasted rice powder.
Add lime juice, fish sauce, and chili powder.
Mix well to combine.
Add shallots, spring onions, mint, and cilantro.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve with fresh vegetables and sticky rice.

recipes.name: Gaeng Daeng Gai (Red Curry Chicken)
instructions: Heat thick coconut cream, fry red curry paste until oil separates.
Add chicken and cook until sealed.
Add remaining coconut milk and bring to simmer.
Add eggplant and kaffir lime leaves.
Cook until chicken is tender and eggplant soft.
Season with fish sauce and palm sugar.
Add Thai basil and chilies at the end.
Serve with jasmine rice.

recipes.name: Pla Rad Prik (Crispy Fish with Chili Sauce)
ingredients: 1 whole Sea Bass or Red Snapper
instructions: Score fish on both sides and coat with rice flour.
Deep fry fish until crispy and cooked through.
In separate pan, fry garlic, chilies, and shallots until fragrant.
Add fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar.
Cook until sauce thickens slightly.
Pour sauce over crispy fish.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.
Serve immediately with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Khanom Krok (Coconut Rice Pancakes)
ingredients: For topping: Coconut cream, spring onions, corn
instructions: Mix rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, salt, and yeast.
Add water to make thin batter. Ferment for 2 hours.
Add pandan juice for flavor and color.
Heat special khanom krok pan.
Pour batter into holes, about 2/3 full.
Add toppings like coconut cream, spring onions, or corn.
Cover and cook until edges are crispy.
Serve warm as snack or dessert.

recipes.name: Yam Talay (Seafood Salad)
instructions: Clean and prepare all seafood.
Boil seafood until just cooked, then cool.
Mix lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar for dressing.
Combine seafood with chilies, shallots, and lemongrass.
Add dressing and toss gently.
Add mint and cilantro just before serving.
Serve with lime wedges.
Best served at room temperature.

recipes.name: Khao Pad Sapparot (Pineapple Fried Rice)
instructions: Heat oil, scramble eggs and set aside.
Add chicken/shrimp and cook until done.
Add curry powder and stir until fragrant.
Add rice and break up any clumps.
Add fish sauce and sugar, mix well.
Add pineapple and cashew nuts.
Return eggs to pan and mix.
Garnish with spring onions and cilantro.
